Job Summary:
With a 9.4 out of 10 Student Satisfaction Rating and our last Waterloo coop being hired full time, we are excited to offer an 8-month coop term in our Finance team. Check out the opportunity below! 


COMPANY OVERVIEW

Venterra Realty is a privately held Canadian corporate success story by any measure. It is a technology company, an investment management company and a commercial real estate company. Venterra has $3.0 billion assets under management; revenue of $250+ million. It owns and operates over 60 multi-unit residential properties, representing more than 17,000 units in the highest growth cities in the Southern U.S. 


Founded in 2001, we haven't just expanded our size; we've grown into a company that is paving a new way in the industry, where our employees can really make a difference, career growth is available, and where our residents are provided an amazing living experience! 


We're honoured to have received the following workplace recognitions:
 

2021 Fortune Best Workplaces for Millennials
2020 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women
2021, 2020, 2019 & 2018 Fortune Best Workplaces in Texas
2021, 2020, 2019, 2018, 2017, & 2016 Fortune Top 100 Best Medium Workplaces
2018 Fortune Best Workplaces for Diversity
2018 Houston Top Workplaces
2021, 2018 Glassdoor Top CEOs
2021, 2017 & 2016 Glassdoor Best Place to Work
50 Most Engaged Workplaces by the Achievers Corporation
And have 100% of our communities recognized as "Top Rated" by ApartmentRatings.com

Community Involvement

As a company built on a culture of unparalleled service and care toward our own communities, we recognize the importance on making a positive impact in the communities where our employees live and work. Our Venterra Cares program provides employees with several opportunities throughout the year to donate to and/or volunteer for various causes and organizations. In 2019, Venterra Realty Canada has chosen to support and work with the Heart and Stroke Foundation, Yellow Brick House, Richmond Hill Community Food Bank, CIBC Run for the Cure, and the Super Sofia Project. Employees can choose which organization(s) to support through planned activities, events and/or fundraising initiatives. Just as we provide our residents with a 'Better Way of Living", we hope to empower our employees to contribute to a 'Better Way' in their communities. 


We are currently all working remote.  This position will be expected to be come into the office as required once a return plan is established.


We are looking for people who:

Have strong personal values and want to work for a values-based company
Are ambitious and hard working with exceptionally high personal standards
Have strong communication skills; are able to succinctly convey complex ideas
Embrace problem-solving and learning new skills
Thrive in a rapidly changing and high growth environment
Are passionate about driving continuous improvements and the use of technology with data to drive business results
Job Responsibilities:
THE OPPORTUNITY


Reporting to our Senior Financial Accountant, the Financial Accountant (Co-op) will be involved in the day-to-day accounting operations of Venterra's corporate entities as well as heavily support the Corporate Reporting team in the preparation of the monthly and annual close processes.  In addition, they will have the opportunity to contribute to exciting projects and initiatives within the department.  


Key Job Responsibilities


Financial Reporting (70%)

Assist in the month-end close including account reconciliations, recording of revenues, and provide support for related management reporting
Perform calculations and prepare the associated journal entries related to cost allocations and intercompany balances
Analyze revenue and expenses and perform detailed variance analyses
Support cash management including preparation of cash flow forecasts across multiple currencies
Work closely with other departments and external partners to perform tasks and monthly analyses
Assist in the preparation of Lender consolidated financial statements
Work closely with PwC and external departments during the annual audit process
Assist in the HST filing and support the Tax team with corporate tax filings as necessary
Track and monitor investor funds for acquisitions as well as property expense recoveries

  

Projects and Initiatives (30%)

Liaise with external departments and PwC during the YE audit process for multiple corporate entities
Participate in the implementation process of a new CRM system
Contribute to ad hoc projects such as development of new reporting processes and financial models
Required Skills:
Candidate Profile

Requirements

Pursuing a university degree preferably in accounting/finance with a strong GPA
Strong analytical and technical skills including Microsoft Excel
Aptitude to leverage technology to gain efficiencies and improve processes
Natural curiosity and willingness to dig into the details and learn new skills
Excellent communication and organizational skills with a strong attention to detail

How You'll Succeed 

Interest in automation and data visualization to drive actionable insights
Attention to detail, and discipline to build automated QA tests for ensuring accuracy of deliverables
Natural curiosity, and passion for digging into the details and learning new skills
Ability to manage multiple deliverables and work autonomously to deliver results
Strong communicator with ability to convey complex ideas in concise and digestible ways
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Economics
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
At Veriday, our people are our number one winning strategy, which is why we strive to attract and retain the very best talent. If you are looking to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we're growing and need people like you to join our team! 


We are looking for a  Financial Analyst as an Intern or Co-Op to be part of the Finance team to join our growing company for 4 months internship to be located anywhere in Canada. As an intern, you will be part of the Finance team-leading financial analysis and modeling initiatives.
Job Responsibilities:
Implement and streamline reporting and analysis
Financial modelling and data visualization
Build and manage complex models through Excel
Simplify and explain complex problems to stakeholders of all levels across multiple functions.
Required Skills:
Student or Graduate with Accounting/Finance as a major or candidates pursuing their CPA. 
1 year of related work experience in Finance/Accounting.
Familiar with implementing, streamline reporting and analysis
Very good financial skills with financial modeling and data visualization expertise
Willingness to bring creative, analytical ideas to Team and management
Advanced Excel ability; you can build and manage complex models with the use of advanced formulas and best modeling practices
An understanding of financial accounting
Analytical approach to work
Problem-solving skills and initiative
Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify and explain complex problems to stakeholders of all levels across multiple functions.
Ability to work on your own and identify value in an unstructured situation

				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing

Job Summary:
Hi, my name is Jane Chae, the Head of Engineering at Versett. I was formerly a co-op student from Waterloo and have worked my way from a developer to a software leader. I've led teams building software solutions from inception to launch.  We are the 'team behind the team' of successful apps, software and platforms around the world with clients like American Express, TD Bank, and Getty Images. Each month, millions of people use the platforms, apps and tools we have built. We have a mission to be the preferred partners of ambitious organizations looking to grow in the modern technology-driven economy.  


Our development team plays a critical role in the definition and delivery of our partner engagements. As our Product Engineer Co-op, you will be solving complex technical problems on client projects working alongside the rest of our Engineering team. Delivering quality code across our technical stack, you will work cross functionally with Product Design led by Dan Rigby and Strategy led by Steven Ritchie to build scalable and reliable solutions positively impacting our client's businesses. 


Our team is tight-knit and built on the philosophy of "learn better, faster". Versett was founded on a shared vision of a place where we can create meaningful work collaboratively, while continuing to grow and learn as individuals. 

Versett works globally and we are looking to build our team in Toronto, ON. 


Business Solution Oriented:  

Product Engineers do not stay in a particular lane or application layer. Each engineer helps define and implement end to end functionality with a cross disciplinary team of Product Design led by Dan Rigby and Strategy led by Steven Ritchie.  


We focus on:  

Integration over writing boilerplate (Generic Framework) functionality, which requires core understanding of architectures that support distributed systems. 

Progressive modernization when dealing with revenue-generating systems and legacy software, creating adaptive interfaces to allow slow migration of system capability over time.  

Balancing speed of implementation with longevity of solutions, which is only ensured by having strong alignment on mission and success metrics. 


Consultant first: Every day we strive to help our clients make well informed decisions that benefit their organizations and end users. The Product Engineer prioritizes understanding and articulating the connection of business problems to software solutions.  


This means that each Product Engineer: 

Has the ability and to work independently and within a team environment 

Is a strong team player, collaborator, and mentor to other engineers 

Communicates effectively and works well with a diverse, cross disciplinary team 

Treats every engagement as an opportunity to consult and educate 

Strong design and analytical skills 


THE BEHAVIOURS WE VALUE AT VERSETT:

You're naturally curious, self-motivated, and always looking to learn more. 

You are supportive of others and enjoy sharing knowledge. 

You have a collaborative mindset and have empathy for your users, clients, project team and co-workers.
Job Responsibilities:
THE OPPORTUNITY:

Driving the success of our products through strong technical delivery, project delivery, and peer enablement. 

Working alongside Solution Architects and Product Engineers doing tangible client project work, with exposure to clients meetings and discussions. 

Receiving peer mentorship through knowledge sharing. 

Delivering on high-quality code, meeting our code standards with the aim of exceeding them. 

Identifying strategic opportunities in projects for improved delivery.  


Day in the Life:

Attend daily project sprint meetings for status updates and new assignments 

Work with Technical lead to get guidance on assigned tasks 

Learning and investigation of new technologies 

Designing and building new features for web and mobile applications, full stack development  

Write Product Documentation: Functional and technical specifications 

Helping with testing and bug fixing 

DevOps -contribute to build/deployment activities  

Contribute to automation tasks   

Developing Versett's Generic Framework 

Contributor to our Design Council (Engineering council where all engineering design and scope decisions are made
Required Skills:
What you bring to the Table:

Focused Generalist: Rather than trying to have as wide of a toolbelt as possible, we try to maintain a focused toolbelt that allows us to solve a lot of common problems. Currently Typescript/Javascript drives our tools of choice, with each team member having or learning foundational competency with deeper focus on one or more subsets of the stack: 

React (Hooks + Context, CSS Modules, Apollo GraphQL) 

NodeJS (Express + GraphQL) 

Postgresql, SQL Server,  MySQL 

TypeScript 

iOs 


Nice to Haves:

Swift, Objective C 

Strapi (a Plus) 

WordPress or other CMS 

Storybook 

Puppeteer 

Google Analytics 

Mongo DB
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Architecture and Design
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Systems Security and Cryptography 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary: The Assistant Field Technician will support the field staff on remediation outings (or wherever operations are carried out). The AFT will be responsible for timely and punctual service to internal and external customers. The AFT will learn soil and water treatments through hands-on field training and experience. He/she will demonstrate a strong safety orientation all at times, particularly when handling chemicals and operational equipment. The AFT will take part in prepping for on-site treatments and perform other related duties to be specified by the Field Operations Manager.
Job Responsibilities:
Load chemicals into vehicles
Review scope of work prior to traveling to the site
On Site job prep and equipment for injection
On Site soil tilling, injection and mixing of chemicals
Job specific paperwork (injection logs and time sheets)
Receiving / handling of chemical shipments
Inventory on chemicals, equipment and supplies
Handle chemicals
Record and report data/errors
Clean and maintain trailers, trucks, pumps & small engines.
Maintain PPE (personal protective equipment)
Organize shop when required
Rebuild equipment/trailers when required
Required Skills:
Safe handling of various chemicals (injection and mixing)
Ability to communicate progress and/or issues to Project Manager
Ability to collaborate in a team environment
Ability to maintain confidentiality
Record-keeping and analysis of raw data
Troubleshooting of mechanical issues
Knowledge of supplies and equipment necessary for remedial operations
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				ENV - Environment, Resources and Sustainability
				
			
				ENV - Geography and Environmental Management
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences
				
			
				SCI - Earth, Environmental and Geological Sciences
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé

Job Summary:
While other social platforms focus on connecting family and friends, our users are brought together by the products and passions that inspire them. Our communities are a place to read reviews, ask questions and get answers, from engaged subject-matter experts and enthusiasts. With flexible hours, an incredible workspace, and all the amenities you'd expect of a high-tech office, the best part of VerticalScope is undoubtedly the people. 


Why We Need You


We're embarking on a journey to change the classic forum and directory listing experience, bringing it into the modern era. As a software engineer at VerticalScope, you will be helping build, test and deploy the supporting software that power performant web apps to our hundreds of millions of users. You'll achieve this by building some of the core systems and tools that aid and empower your peers to deliver value as effectively as possible. You'll be growing and learning with your fellow teammates in addition to collaborating closely with the other teams as we strive to build excellent software that delights our users.
Job Responsibilities:
How you'll contribute

You'll write performant, secure, highly-available services that will be used by millions of users.
You understand the importance of building an observable system, you will help build services that support tracing and also measure and monitor important metrics.
You'll write highly testable software in line with our TDD approach. 
You'll learn the best practices and principles for cloud architecture as well as get hands-on experience developing and deploying distributed systems to the cloud.
Participating in peer-code reviews ensuring the team is continuously producing top-quality code.
Work in an agile environment with a tight nit focused product-oriented team where you'll participate in all aspects of the product life cycle, from ideation, to sprint planning, to deployment.
Required Skills:
Your traits

You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and have no problem explaining or walking other people through complex technical problems.
You are open-minded and consider other people's thoughts and opinions carefully 
You're comfortable owning your own code throughout its entire lifecycle and willing to be on call for production issues.
You have a constant desire to learn and improve yourself

Minimum Requirements

You're a quick learner and are capable of solving any technical challenge with the tools at hand. We don't require you to know any specific languages, we do expect you to be capable of picking up new languages fairly quickly.
You're open to the idea of pair programming
You understand the limitations and tradeoffs between consistency and availability when building a distributed system.
You have an understanding of how the web and the various protocols and components that are commonly in use today work. (CDNs, Caching, TLS, ServiceWorkers, HTTP/2)

  

Some of the technologies in use

PHP, Go, Java, Scala, Python/Django, React, JavaScript, WordPress
GCP, Kubernetes(GKE), MySQL, Postgres, Kafka, Redis, Elasticsearch
BigQuery, Spark, Spanner, AutoML, Tensorflow, CoreNLP
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Quality Assurance 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Systems Security and Cryptography 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary: Position is responsible for the transition and coordination of required engineering activities to support, analyze and execute on awarded labour quotes for PCBA and System-level assemblies for existing and potential customers. Position will work directly with Vexos' process and test engineering groups, operations staff and management members in carrying out their responsibilities.
Job Responsibilities:
The key responsibilities of the Engineering Associate Co-op include the following. This list is not exhaustive and may change based on business, departmental and operational requirements:
 

Quote Package - Review Internal Quote DB and transition main elements of awarded quotes into Engineering execution schedule including manufacturing expectations, NRE, Labor quotes and equipment requirements.
 Setup Project, NRE and engineering assignment based on assigned teams and responsibilities.
 Review Quote model and export cycle time algorithm for labor content and routing information. 
 Analyze Product Checklist (PCL) and format labor routing to match for input into Syspro.
 Import master production schedule and manage priorities based on engineering assignments and timelines to meet deadlines and production requirements.
Coordinate with Component Engineering as required to initiate scrubs, AVL corrections and synchronization.
Working with the process and test engineering, setup and manage work centers to support routing setup.
Working with manufacturing management determine work center resourcing and available capacity.
 Manage routing accuracy, completeness and gaps and work with process engineering to correct structures to resolve.
 Manage capacity resource planning through routing, eMES and current demand to determine proper resource levels based on labor requirements.
Validate actual labor, yields and assumptions vs. actual through cost rollup, cycle time and Technomatix and work with engineering and program management to resolve.
Responsible for predicting output based on cycle time and resourcing and recommending batch size adjustments, tooling and resource optimization.
Assist in asset management, new equipment introduction, gold sample and related equipment maintenance and management requirement.
Strategic projects and project management as requested by manager.
Other duties as required.
Required Skills:
Qualifications, Skills and Experience:

Engineering degree or suitable technical qualifications/experience preferably in industrial or manufacturing engineering 

Experience in Excel, Access, Agile, Kinaxis and MAX an asset 

Production and Operations Analysis/ Manufacturing Optimization will be considered as a definite asset 

Previous experience in a manufacturing environment, preferably in the EMS industry is desirable however not mandatory 

Transferrable or related experience is preferred however not required
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Vidyard is looking for incredible talent to join our engineering team and play a critical role as we continue to build and improve our video platform. 

Our engineering team is composed of generalists who strive to maintain both front and back end expertise. If you are a generalist, who is looking to work on and own full features and make a significant impact during your next co-op term - we'd love to chat! 


What does Vidyard do?

Vidyard is the video platform that helps businesses transform communications and succeed through the strategic use of online video. Going beyond video hosting and management, we help businesses connect with more viewers through interactive and personalized video experiences, track detailed insights on their viewing audience, turn insights into results with enterprise integrations, and prove the impact of their video programs. 


 Why do a Co-Op at Vidyard?


CHECK OUT THIS VIDEO FOR A MESSAGE FROM PAST CO-OP STUDENTS! 


You have the opportunity to make an impact within your role by leading and contributing to meaningful projects during your time here. Your team and the broader company are here to support and assist you in your learning every step of the way. Not only that, but we set our Co-ops up for success both during your term with us and for the future. 

With many businesses moving to work from home, Vidyard's product is needed more than ever! We are growing, moving at lightning speed and innovating so if that's something that interests you, we look forward to seeing you apply. 

Vidyard is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should notify the Talent Acquisition Team.
Job Responsibilities:
Our engineering team is composed of generalists who strive to maintain both front and back end expertise. If you are a generalist, who is looking to work on and own full features and make a significant impact during your next co-op term - we'd love to chat! 


Past projects our co-ops have worked on include: revamping our video player interface, developing new data integrations into other platforms, creating new user dashboards and tools, and improving video recording tools. We encourage developers to tackle problems that align with their skills and interests. 


CHECK OUT THIS VIDEO FOR A MESSAGE FROM PAST CO-OP STUDENTS!
Required Skills:
To be an effective team member, you will have experience with some of the following technologies:

- Ruby on Rails, Node.js or other MVC web frameworks 

- JavaScript, Vue.js, React, jQuery 

- HTML, CSS 

- MySQL or other relational databases 

- Git & Github 

- Redis or other NoSQL databases 

- Automated testing with RSpec or similar 

- Interacting with and building web APIs/services 

- Amazon EC2 and Heroku 

- PHP, Python or other scripting languages would be an asset

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Are you looking for a unique HR opportunity to become part of a small but mighty Talent team in a high-growth company?  If you're looking for a "golden" Talent Acquisition Co-Op role to gain broad experience within all things talent acquisition and make an impact immediately, we'd love to hear from you! Open to a 4 or 8 month term!  The Talent Acquisition Co-Op will have the opportunity to participate in all aspects of Vidyard's recruitment and selection processes and provide general support to the day-to-day operations of the talent acquisition team. In addition, the Talent Acquisition Co-Op will be assigned special projects to continue to bring new ideas and process improvements to Vidyard's hiring practices, and will work on new initiatives to enhance and promote those hiring practices and onboarding.  


What does Vidyard do?


Vidyard is the video platform that helps businesses transform communications and succeed through the strategic use of online video. Going beyond video hosting and management, we help businesses connect with more viewers through interactive and personalized video experiences, track detailed insights on their viewing audience, turn insights into results with enterprise integrations, and prove the impact of their video programs. 


Why do a Co-Op at Vidyard?


You have the opportunity to make an impact within your role by leading and contributing to meaningful projects during your time here. Your team and the broader company are here to support and assist you in your learning every step of the way. Not only that, but we set our Co-ops up for success both during your term with us and for the future. 

With many businesses moving to work from home, Vidyard's product is needed more than ever! We are growing, moving at lightning speed and innovating so if that's something that interests you, we look forward to seeing you apply. 


Vidyard is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or interview process should notify the Talent Acquisition Team.
Job Responsibilities:
As a Talent Co-op you will:

Job Summary:
**Students Live and/or must be willing to relocate to Vancouver in January 2022


Visier is the leader in People Analytics and Workforce Intelligence - serving marquis clients with insights into their people and elevating HR's ability to drive business strategy through talent. Recently closing a hugely successful funding round and a landmark $1b valuation, Visier is embarking on an incredible phase of its 11 year growth Journey. 


Our co-op experience is unique and designed to prepare you for professional success as you work on real, impactful work from the beginning...not features that may be mothballed after 8 months of hard work! 


Our ultimate goal is to give you the mentorship, training and work experience you need to start your career. A number of our students return to us after they graduate and start developing their professional career at Visier! We use cool state-of-the-art technology that is common in large scalable systems involving lots of data, our frameworks include Cassandra, kubernetes and Kafka.  You'll also have the opportunity to learn fundamental AWS skills that are transferable anywhere.   


As a Test Developer Co-op at Visier, you will work with the Quality Assurance Team and will be responsible for ensuring the integrity of the Visier application. 


Perks? 

We know a thing or two about those… and so, we're hooking you up! We have everything from free virtual yoga classes, happy hours...think magicians, comedy shows and health and wellness classes. You'll spend your first weeks in an immersive boot camp to learn coding in a Visier environment and you'll have a buddy/mentor assigned to you to support your ongoing professional development. On top of that you'll get to rest and relax with paid vacation, and paid volunteer days!
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll be doing...

Manual testing, building automated tests, and data validation
Working with developers to create and sign off test plans
Writing unit tests, integration tests and end-to-end UI automation acceptance tests
Setting up Jenkins CI pipeline to automate common tasks
Performing final checks to ensure the software we release is beautiful
Required Skills:
What you'll bring to the table...

Coding skills in writing functional tests using Selenium, JMETER, and Java
Some knowledge in one of the following areas:
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms
Knowledge of web technologies (REST, XML, JSON, Angular8)
Knowledge of SQL databases and SQL language is an asset
Attention to detail, tendency to spot mistakes and identify potential improvements
You roll up your sleeves
You make it easy
You are proud
You never stop learning 
You play to win
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering

Job Summary: At Vital, what we do matters. As a leader in the medical imaging software industry, this is at the heart of every product we develop, every service we provide and each member of our team. Vital is part of Canon Medical Systems, and together we lead the industry with the latest health imaging informatics solutions. We improve the quality of patient care by developing innovative products that enable the storage, exchange and analysis of clinical information across health care enterprises and communities. Our products handle millions of medical images and health records each day around the world. Vital Images provides the best of both worlds with a dynamic and collaborative environment, casual culture, and agility of a mid-sized company, while having the support and resources of Canon.
Job Responsibilities:
BASIC PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES

The Software Engineer in Test at Vital Images works closely with other members of the product development team to ensure our products deliver on the promised value.  In this role you will:
 
 

Write software for products and/or test tools.
Lay the groundwork for new test development automation and frameworks by helping select cutting-edge technologies
Aid in the definition and documentation of the test strategy, approach, and plan.
Document test results and compile metrics for further analysis.
Prepares and executes automated tests based upon test strategy/plans in order to identify defects prior to production.
Ensure the business, technical and functional requirements are being met throughout the Software Development Lifecycle.
Required Skills:
What you bring to the team:
We're most interested in smart, curious, engaged QA Engineers.

Must have:
You'll need to demonstrate to us that you have these. Show us something you've worked on, tell us a story, share your passion.
- Bachelor of Science/Programming Diploma or equivalent experience
- Skilled at writing scripts in BAsh/SH & Python
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Excellent problem solving, analytical skills.
- Able to work independently.

Nice to have:
- Knowledge of healthcare standers (HL7, DICOM, IHE).
- Knowledge of client-side and server-side web technologies such as XHTML, JS, CSS, GWT etc.
- Understanding of Agile software development and Test Driven Development (TDD).
- Experience with Selenium
- Experience with Mac OS X and/or some flavour of Linux, because that's what we mostly work with

Job Summary: At Vital, what we do matters. As a leader in the medical imaging software industry, this is at the heart of every product we develop, every service we provide and each member of our team. Vital is part of Canon Medical Systems, and together we lead the industry with the latest health imaging informatics solutions. Our products handle millions of medical images and health records each day around the world. Job Responsibilities:
BASIC PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES

Software Engineers develop clean, reliable and well-tested components and frameworks to simplify the exchange of healthcare information.  We use a wide variety of technologies in the development of our and we work in an iterative, sprint-based development environment with daily stand ups and regular demos. 
The role

Be a member of an agile development team that designs and builds products to securely store, exchange, and understand patient data for large medical imaging networks
Develop data management solutions optimized for advanced data analytics
Write, review and test code in an iterative development model, contributing to a regular release cycle
Respond to results from nightly builds, adjusting code as necessary to ensure the solution is functional and meets the requirements
Lay the groundwork for new application development and frameworks by helping select cutting-edge technologies
Required Skills:
Must have 

Willingness and ability to learn new technologies
Strong aptitude for solving problems independently
Solid grounding in computer science and software engineering concepts and best practices
Solid understanding of modern software design and unit/system testing
Understanding of networking concepts (sockets, TCP/IP, etc.)
Ability to develop maintainable, production-quality code
Excellent verbal and written communications skills

Nice to have 

Experience with Java or like programming language
Scripting experience (Bash, Python, Groovy, etc.)
Knowledge of healthcare standards, such as HL7, DICOM and IHE

What we offer you 
This is an environment in which things move quickly - there is a lot to do and you'll have the opportunity to wear many hats if you want to. Our Waterloo office is located in UpTown within walking distance of University of Waterloo, Waterloo Park and countless local eateries and coffee shops.  We enjoy a fun and dynamic workplace culture in a beautiful building that boasts exposed brick and beams, comfortable collaborative workspaces, plenty of natural light and an incredible roof-top patio for our much-loved BBQ lunches.  We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Job Summary:
Location: Headquarters are in Toronto, but we're open to mostly remote work. 

  

Do you love solving complex problems, and want to see your work applied in real life?  Are you passionate about deep learning and computer vision?  We are looking for people who are self-directed and driven by a desire for excellence as much as by curiosity and a desire to learn by solving previously unsolvable problems. 

  

As a Deep Learning Intern, you will work with our talented Deep Learning team to build vision models that can perform novel tasks at unprecedented levels of performance.  This requires expertise in image segmentation and processing, object detection, ideally in video, and the ability to transfer the latest research into production-ready code. 

  

Our vision at Vivid Machines is to revolutionize agricultural production to help solve food security globally. To do this, we're building cutting edge technology, including multispectral sensors - so you'll get to work with some really interesting data! 

  


Who we are and what we do:

  

Vivid Machines is an exciting new venture-backed start-up created out of Entrepreneur First.  We're building cutting edge technology to help fruit and vegetable farmers with yield management, and detection of pests, diseases, and nutrient deficiencies.  We have an aggressive goal to bring our products to the world quickly. 

  

We value excellence, integrity, curiosity and passion, people who are open-minded then decisive, and the ability to iterate quickly and deliver. We're innovators on a mission!
Job Responsibilities:
What You Will Be Doing

 
 

Data preprocessing and feature engineering
Designing and implementing Deep Learning algorithms to deliver high-accuracy production-quality models on vast novel datasets,
Creating algorithms for image segmentation & object detection,
Concept to release lifecycle of machine learning applications.

  

We have a loft workspace in Toronto, but will be keeping an eye on the Covid-19 pandemic before requiring any in-office work.  When we choose to re-open, it will be done following government guidelines, ensuring the safety of all our staff, and accommodating flexibility in work location. 

  

People from all backgrounds can succeed at Vivid Machines. We believe differences and diversity help build excellent businesses.
Required Skills:
We're looking for people with: 

 

2+ years of hands-on, real-world experience with Computer Vision and/or Deep Learning. Especially in the domains of Perception, Object Detection, and Segmentation, and Multiple Object Tracking,
Proficiency in Python and DL frameworks like PyTorch and Tensorflow,
Ability to translate academic literature into high-quality production code with a strong sense of good system design,
Experience working with large image and video datasets,
Owning problems end-to-end, with a willingness to pick up whatever knowledge is missing to get the job done.

  

Bonus Points  

 

Experience deploying to edge/mobile, resource-constrained, and/or embedded platforms,
Model Compression techniques (Quantization, Pruning, Distillation),
Distributed Training,
Few-shot Learning, Transfer Learning.

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software

				ENG - Software Engineering

Our vision at Vivid Machines is to revolutionize agricultural production to help solve food security globally.  Our initial focus is on helping fruit and vegetable farmers improve the quality and quantity of produce they can generate on existing acreage while also improving sustainability.  To do this, we are building cutting edge technology, including hyperspectral sensors and state-of-the-art computer vision models, all while delivering a seamless experience to farmers. 

  

As an Embedded Systems Software Engineer, you will architect, design, and develop software for a multispectral data acquisition system.  You'll develop system software for embedded platforms, build robust APIs, and collaborate with the hardware team to create an amazing product and solve one of the world's most important problems. 

  

Do you love solving complex vision problems, and want to see your work applied in real life?  We are looking for people who are self-directed and driven by a desire for excellence as much as by curiosity and a desire to learn by solving previously unsolvable problems.

We value excellence, integrity, curiosity and passion, people who are open-minded then decisive, and the ability to iterate quickly and deliver. We're innovators on a mission!

Architect, design, and develop software for a novel multispectral data acquisition system,
Develop low-level firmware to bring up new hardware platforms,
Design and implement efficient video processing pipelines to solve challenging computer vision problems,
Develop APIs to interface with cloud infrastructure as well as local devices

We have a loft workspace in Toronto, but will be keeping an eye on the Covid-19 pandemic before requiring any in-office work.  When we choose to re-open, it will be done following government guidelines, ensuring the safety of all our staff, and accommodating flexibility in work location. 

  

People from all backgrounds can succeed at Vivid Machines. We believe differences and diversity help build excellent businesses.

A background in Electrical, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science with experience in embedded software/hardware development,
Proficient writing robust C/C++,

Experience with embedded vision systems, image processing, video encoding,
Experience designing and assembling PCBs,
Experience in writing drivers for various peripherals over various interfaces, such as I2C, SPI, USB, PCIe,

Job Summary: VN Instruments is a small company that focuses on air coupled ultrasonics mainly for industrial clients.  We've found our way into a wide range of commercial and research projects.  At the present time we are developing an acoustic anemometer and another type of sensor to monitor Saltation for use on the planet Mars.  A Saltation sensor detects particle impacts from wind driven dust and sand.  We are part way through hardware and software development.  The work may involve sensor development, associated physics as well as hardware design and or software to help test, evaluate and optimize results.  There are a number of possible projects so the job will depend on the applicants interests and abilities.  Expect an interesting project and some real challenges!
Job Responsibilities:
Basic job responsibilities may include scientific programming as well as the application of fundamental physics theory to sensor development and testing. The successful applicant will be expected to learn the different elements of hardware and software involved in the design process. Their work may include lab testing and work with vacuum systems in addition to temperature and environmental testing using LN2. 


The focus of this work term will be on testing and characterizing various sensors for use in extraterrestrial environments (Mars, Venus). The student will be deriving useful information by analyzing signal data from different sources (saltation sensors, optical particle detectors, ultrasonic transducers). They will be focused on studying the underlying physics of the designed systems. There will also be opportunity for students to work through specific stages of the development process (circuit board design and analysis, embedded programming, automation, sensor characterization, etc.).
Required Skills:
We don't have any particular required skills but the applicant should expect to learn and develop new skills as part of the work. There will be a strong focus on physics and modeling of the complex physical interactions between particles impacting a detector and the resulting acoustic signatures. 


Helpful skills
 

  Reasonable knowledge of applied physics 
 
Programming in Python, C (or C++) and/or Matlab 
 
Basic circuit theory 
 
Lab experience
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				- Theme - Scientific Experimental Design and Laboratory Assistance
				
			
				SCI - Physics
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Would you like to be a part of a growing organization? See how a business is developed and growth is achieved in a very successful start-up company. 

  

You will get an opportunity to directly contribute to the success of our business and independently lead various initiatives related to Sales, Marketing, Social Media and Operations. 

  

Buildings generate nearly 40% of annual global GHG emissions with HVAC systems accounting for 50% of the energy usage. Voyager Buildings is on a mission to help clients like Amazon and RioCan, combat climate change by reducing carbon emissions and energy consumption in buildings by designing, implementing and optimizing HVAC systems. 

  

We offer turnkey automation solutions for new and existing buildings. We leverage artificial intelligence alongside building automation systems to decrease your carbon emissions and operating cost while increasing occupant comfort. 

  

We are looking to hire up to 2 co-op students for the Winter 2022 Term.  

  

This is a hybrid position: Remote + in-person meetings/events and potential site visits as required.
Job Responsibilities:
Marketing & Communications Intern

Job Summary:
About Voyis:

Voyis designs and manufactures high performance underwater optical sensors (lasers, cameras, lights)  for autonomous underwater vehicles that expand capability and enhance understanding in underwater surveys and exploration. Our products have enabled our customers to survey more than 10,000km of ocean floor across all 7 continents, helping people better understand those remote, challenging environments. Our mission is to push the limits of what's possible subsea and enable every subsea vehicle to see the depths like we see the surface. 


Our underwater laser scanners, cameras and lights are proudly designed, engineered, and built in Waterloo, Canada. Voyis operates independently under ownership of Sonardyne Group. 

  

What you'll do:

As a Mechatronics Engineering Co-op at Voyis you will work closely with our mechanical designers and systems engineers to support critical product development projects. The role will involve mechanical design CAD work as well as hands-on testing with machined components, camera and lens assemblies, and electrical assemblies. Rigorous attention to detail and presenting results in a clear, succinct way are essential. You will also be involved in defining, designing, and implementing tools for our production team to use in assembly and test of this a new laser-scanner product. 


We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and work collaboratively with our multidisciplinary engineering team to achieve industry leading results. We are a small team with loads of exciting opportunities where everyone is expected to take ownership and push boundaries in order to achieve our goals, together.
Job Responsibilities:
Specific responsibilities include:

Execute on component and system level testing to evaluate mechanical assemblies, cameras and optical assemblies, and electronics systems
Design and drive the implementation of fixtures and tools for calibration, assembly and testing of LED, camera, and laser systems
Summarize test data and perform analysis on result to support key decisions on component selection
Evaluate machined components on first-time designs, performing quality verification and providing feedback to engineering team and vendors
Required Skills:
Skills you will bring to the table:

Proven experience with component and assembly design in Solidworks
Extensive practical experience with FDM and SLA 3D printing
Familiar with manufacturing and assembly fixture designs
Hands on experience with mechanical-electrical assemblies, using torque tools
Pursuing a degree in Mechanical, Mechatronics, or similar engineering degree
A positive attitude where you continuously strive for improvement and have the ability to succeed without all the answers 

Bonus Points for:

Hands on experience with basic wiring harnesses, soldering, crimping
Experience with handling optics and ESD-sensitive electronics
Basic experience with python or linux commands
Experience in or a passion for the underwater discovery and robotics
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Nanotechnology Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
We are looking for a Mechanical/Mechatronics Engineering Co-op to join our Precision Systems & Solutions Community to work on tools, equipment, and measurement setups that will enable integration of millions of micrometer solid state devices into a surface to make smart surfaces.
 
You will be working in a multidisciplinary environment with industry professionals to contribute to the development of precision equipment and measurement systems that will revolutionize the display industry.
Job Responsibilities:
YOUR Day-to-day Activities:
- Actively participate in the design test fixtures and precision motion systems used in optical test measurements
- Build, assemble, and test your designs to verify performance requirements are met
- Generate appropriate documentation to showcase designs, including part & assembly drawings, presentations, bill of materials, test reports, etc.
- Participate in, and present at design review meetings related multidisciplinary projects
- Collaborating with fellow VUE Masters from different teams through various activities
Required Skills:
How YOU will Succeed:
- You have practical experience utilizing microcontrollers to automate real world projects
- You are a builder who likes getting your hands dirty working with various hand and power tools
- You have proficiency in creating complex parts and assemblies with 3D computer aided design (CAD) software, preferably Solidworks 
- You have strong knowledge of manufacturing methods and rapid prototyping techniques, prior experience with 3D printers is considered a strong asset
- Experience with, or knowledge of light measurements or photography would be considered an asset
- You have proven communication skills, both written and verbal
- Having the stamina to get knocked down 100 times but the drive to get back up and do it all again

Job Summary:
Waabi, founded by AI pioneer and visionary Raquel Urtasun, is an AI company building the next generation of self-driving technology. With a world class team and an innovative approach that unleashes the power of AI to "drive" safely in the real world, Waabi is bringing the promise of self-driving closer to commercialization than ever before. Waabi is backed by best-in-class investors across the technology, logistics and the Canadian innovation ecosystem. 


With offices in Toronto and San Francisco, Waabi is growing quickly and looking for diverse, innovative and collaborative candidates who want to impact the world in a positive way. To learn more visit: www.waabi.ai
Job Responsibilities:
You will... 

- Be part of a team of multidisciplinary Research Scientists and Engineers using an AI-first approach to enable safe self-driving at scale. 

-  Lead or Contribute to an AI research project, pushing the frontiers of the field by developing new algorithms for Autonomous Vehicle (AV). This includes topics such as perception, prediction, motion planning, controls, simulation, mapping, localization, core AI, etc. 

- Design, implement, train, and optimize novel algorithms on self-driving vehicles and various production systems.  

- Be encouraged to submit and publish work externally at top machine learning, computer vision, and robotics conferences (NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR, etc.), post to our company blog, and release open source projects.
Required Skills:
Qualifications: 

- Bachelors or MS/PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, AI, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Robotics and/or similar technical field(s) of study. 

- Demonstrated research/software engineering experience: through previous internships, work experience, coding competitions, and/or research projects and papers. 

- Strong quantitative background and coursework in or working knowledge of linear algebra, calculus, and probability. 

- Proficient in reading and coding in Python and/or C++.. 

- Open-minded and collaborative team player with willingness to help others. 

- Passionate about self-driving technologies, solving hard problems, and creating innovative solutions.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Waddell Engineering provides engineering services for a wide variety of structures. These range from smaller projects such as industrial racks, agricultural sheds, and residential beam designs, all the way up to larger projects such as commercial shops, animal barns, and multi-generational homes. We pride ourselves with the ability to provide to our clients optimal engineering solutions in an accommodative timeline. While we take on projects of many different shapes and sizes, we have special expertise in agricultural and industrial projects. We are currently seeking an engineering CO-OP student who is passionate about structural engineering or is enthusiastic to learn more about it. 


To see some of our current projects, check out out social media:  

Instagram - @waddell_engineering  

Tiktok - @waddell_engineering
Job Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to assist in the structural design of agricultural, residential, commercial, and industrial projects. Working closely with Waddell's Engineers and EITs, your primary responsibilities will include:
 

Translating plans and sections onto RISA-3D for structural analysis
Using spreadsheets and hand-calculations to design or check structural members
Creating markups on plans to reflect structural changes and requirements
Quality assurance checks of 3D models
Researching and recommending connection products
Required Skills:
To be considered for this position, candidates should have the following attributes:
 

Proficiency in reading architectural and structural plans
Proficiency with drafting software and 3D modeling programs such as AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp, SolidWorks, RISA-3D, etc. (It's not required to know these, but experience is an asset)
Good spatial awareness
Highly organized, motivated, and curious worker with a good attitude and enthusiasm for learning
Ability to learn new programs and concepts quickly and with minimal direction
Flexible work habits, able to multi-task and remain efficient in a fast-paced work environment, comfortable with shifting priorities and timelines

Job Summary:
INTRODUCTION


Walker Place is a home for individuals 18 and older with recovered mental health diagnosis. All of Walker Place's support care workers ensure and promote high quality resident-centered care. Employees of Walker Place will gain valuable first-hand experience in learning how to interact and manage the various situational challenges that come with mental health work. Overall, we are focused on building a safe and welcoming community environment for the residents.
Job Responsibilities:
Always consult with your Supervisor and seek for advice if there are any concerns

Provide appropriate resident centered care, including household work such as: cleaning living spaces, laundry, and preparing food as per schedule.
Meals/Snack preparation, and cleaning duties are approximately 3 - 4 hours/day. Maintaining cleanliness of the home to meet the requirements as set out by Ministry of Health and Huron Perth Public Health.
Responsibility in administering and recording daily medication.
Monitoring resident's mood and behavior through writing progress reports and incident reports.
Maintain professional skills and techniques to manage mental health of residents, and effective mediation of any behavioral problems.
Appropriate daily interaction with residents: requires listening, and caring for the residents' needs, as well as discussing with the team of staff to provide further care.
Build up trustful relationship with residents. 
Promoting independence, and encouraging resident's involvement in their daily activities e.g. encouraging them to fold their clothes, tidy & clean their room, etc.
Organizing social and recreational activities in individual wellness plans as required.
Co-ordinating and/or escort for medical appointments, and appointments with various mental health agencies as needed.
Communicating with family members of residents as needed (and only with resident's consent). 
Carefully following best safety practices and ensuring a safe work environment at all times e.g. Following CHO guidelines, Home Policies and Procedures, Privacy and Confidentiality, Infection Prevention and Control measures, Health and Safety measures, Fire Safety, WHMIS, Workplace Violence Prevention, and other related Regulations
Participate in fire drills to ensure resident safety
Required Skills:
First Aid and CPR Certificate
Food Handler Certificate
Effective communication skill
Preferable knowledge of psychological studies

Job Summary:
About Waratah Capital Advisors

Waratah Capital Advisors is a Toronto-based asset manager that specializes in alternative strategies. Waratah manages over $3.09 billion in assets from high-net-worth individuals, family offices, foundations, Canadian bank platforms, and pension funds. With a team of 47 experienced professionals, Waratah combines intensive research-driven stock selection with a disciplined and robust risk management program. Founders and employees collectively represent over $170 million of the firm's assets under management. 


An Overview

This role tests and develops your academic and personal capabilities in the Finance and Accounting space. This role has considerable responsibilities from day one that will develop soft and hard skills, maximizing your career potential.
Job Responsibilities:
Waratah has an enduring reputation of delivering strong risk-adjusted returns and is regarded among the best asset managers in Canada.  We are looking for the brightest minds to contribute to this continued success. We focus on hiring individuals with intelligence, dedication, integrity, and curiosity. 

Suitable candidates to join the Finance team are analytical, interpersonal, team players, and multi-taskers. The role encompasses a wide range of functions, some of the day to day work you will be responsible for includes: 

•             Assisting in weekly and monthly NAV reconciliation process 

•             Assisting in reconciliation of expense reports 

•             Assisting in various reports for quarter-end and month-end 

•             Preparing the monthly performance report and coordinate with marketing team 

•             Conducting tax and accounting research and analysis 

•             Assisting in the operational procedures of the firm and its funds
Required Skills:
Waratah is a rapidly growing firm, and you can expect your role to evolve and grow in scope as your skills develop. 


•             Working towards the completion of a bachelor's or graduate degree in accounting or finance 

•             Deadline driven with the ability to multi-task 

•             A strong team player 

•             A high level of attention to detail 

•             Positive attitude 

•             An understanding of the investment world 

•             Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting

Job Summary:
Who Are We? 

We are one of Ontario's largest independent accounting firms, with over 100 staff and 60+ years' experience.  We bring expertise in accounting, tax, business advisory, succession and estate planning, bookkeeping, human resources and wealth management.  We work as a team to bring value to the lives of each other, our clients and our community.  

  


What You Can Expect: 


Balance: We strive to maximize our staff's full potential without sacrificing personal life.  Our staff enjoys flex time throughout the year, with reasonable core hours.  In tax season we require 50 to 55-hour weeks from the end of February to the end of April.  All hours above 44 per week are paid out as overtime pay.  


Professional Development: We challenge our staff with a broad range of tasks and provide a dedicated mentor to support your development and career goals.  We are a CPA training facility; we'll pay your annual student fees and once a CPA, annual dues.  We also pay course fees for all levels of the PEP program, preparation courses (ex. Densmore) and the CFE. 


Opportunity: Your goals aren't too big for us and we are dedicated to helping you reach your full potential.  We are a growing firm and provide upward progression opportunities, right to Partner if that's how big you dream. 


Compensation: We offer a highly competitive compensation package, including overtime pay and once full-time, you can look forward to benefits, an abundance of time off and a bonus plan that rewards exceptional performance. 


Social: We have fun!  We believe in working hard but playing hard too.  Our team enjoys several company social events throughout the year, dinners and treats during tax season too. 


Culture: Our environment is relaxed.  We are open and approachable - co-ops engage with Principals and Partners.  We are big business meets small town. 


Lifestyle: Enjoy small town living or an easy 35 minute drive from Waterloo - no traffic, just the odd horse and buggy. 


BONUS: Please let us know in your application if you have Agriculture background and/or experience! One of our positions will be working directly with many Agriculture clients.
Job Responsibilities:
What You'll Be Doing:
 

Preparation of personal tax returns. Produce documentation for CRA post assessments.
Prepare various documents and reports, including T4/T5 slips and summaries.
Liaise and correspond professionally with clients, colleagues, the CRA and the firm leadership team
Required Skills:
What We're Looking For:
 

Currently enrolled in an Accounting or related program, with plans to pursue a CPA designation
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to quickly learn new software & processes
Ability to grasp understanding of a variety of businesses/industries
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work both independently and in a team setting
Effective time management skills
Organized and ability to multi-task
Willingness to seek assistance as required, and perform necessary research and follow-up
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Business
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Warp: The cloud-backed terminal for individuals and teams


At Warp, we are modernizing the command line experience to make it more intuitive and collaborative for modern developers and teams, turning the terminal into a real platform to enable engineering workflows. Our team is excited to have this opportunity to radically improve a tool that every developer uses and fundamentally change how software development and devops are done. 


Our early team is Zach Lloyd (former Google Principal Eng & lead on GDocs), Shikhiu Ing (former UX Lead for GDocs), Aloke Desai (former Senior Eng on GDocs), Michelle Lim (Yale, Neo Scholar), Zheng Tao (Dropbox, Gem, Waterloo grad), Charles Pierce (former Staff Eng at LinkedIn), Agata Cieplik (Dropbox Infrastructure) and Kevin Yang (Minerva, LinkedIn). 


We are looking for engineering interns and co-op students to join us and help bring Warp to the world. 


We recently raised a seed round, and are backed by top-tier investors, as well as notable angels like Marc Benioff and the founders of Figma and Coda. 


Early Traction


You will be joining us during an exciting phase of the company. We recently exited stealth and appeared on the top of HackerNews (twice in the same day!).  Our release video on Twitter was viewed over 125k times and was retweeted by the GitHub CEO.  


We have built a large waitlist and are slowly letting users into the product while getting feedback.  You can join our Discord here if you'd like to check out our current community. 


The Product


The CLI is one of the few tools that all developers use every day, and yet it has seen little innovation in the past 40 years. 


We are reinventing this tool to make it more usable and collaborative, turning it from a low-level utility into a modern product.  Because the terminal is so ubiquitous and so antiquated, there is an opportunity to meaningfully elevate developer productivity across the board. 


The Technology

Our stack is Rust + native graphics on the client, WASM + WebGL in the browser, and Go on the server.  Mac is our first platform, followed by Web, Linux and Windows. 


There are a ton of interesting technical problems to solve:
 

How to build a high-performance Rust GUI app (we have our own UI framework and render directly to the GPU)
How to integrate with existing shells like bash, zsh and fish, while innovating on the CLI
How to build a set of secure cloud services to facilitate collaboration in the CLI

And more… 


The Business Opportunity


We believe there is an opportunity to build a unicorn-sized business improving the command-line. It's one of very few tools used by every developer every day, and its low position in the developer stack makes it an ideal gateway to improve all sorts of developer activities. 


Our strategy is bottom-up developer adoption followed by driving revenue through enterprise sales and distribution partnerships.  Developers are our users; companies are our paying customers. 


To start, we will focus on wide developer adoption, with a goal becoming the everyday terminal of choice.  Warp will be open-source, free to download and install, and immediately usable as a backwards-compatible terminal replacement with the developer's shell of choice. 


Its main value initially will be a better UI plus some hero features like terminal notebooks, infinite history, and real-time collaboration. 


In addition to the open-source terminal client, we will also build a closed-source server, implementing all of the cloud-enabled features. These features will have a freemium model - free for small teams, but paid once you hit a usage or user threshold. 


These features will encourage sharing (e.g. create a notebook and share it with your team), and sharing will drive growth. 


Simultaneously we will focus on building a community and an ecosystem of terminal plugins and apps, creating network effects. 


At higher levels of team penetration we will offer an enterprise plan with features around privacy, security and environment management (e.g. secure distribution and management of API keys). These larger enterprise plans will be the ultimate driver of revenue, along with potential distribution deals for companies that see CLI integrations as a way to reach new customers. 


The ultimate goal is to be one of two main apps that developers use daily (along with the code editor). If we can achieve that goal, we are confident in building a huge business. 


Our Culture


We are a company run by developers, building a core product for all developers.   


We are committed to understanding our users deeply. We believe we will ultimately build the best product and business if that team includes developers from a wide range of backgrounds. 


We value honesty, humility, and pragmatism, and our core product principle is focusing on the user. 


To get more of a feel for what our company values on the engineering side, please take a look at our internal How We Work guide and Zach's blog, https://thezbook.com/. 


Company Info


We are based in NYC and SF, but we are location agnostic, as we are building a distributed company.  We have a small opt-in office in NYC. 


We are currently a team of 8: Zach, Shikhiu, Aloke, Michelle, Zheng, Charles, Agata and Kevin.
Job Responsibilities:
If you join us, you'll have the opportunity to: 

* Work on a product that all developers use every day 

* Do meaningful engineering work - we are looking for real contributions from our interns 

* Learn professional software development and be mentored from an experienced team 

* Be exposed to other aspects of startups, such as product development, project management, customer development. 

* Tackle challenging technical problems - one of the main reasons there has been little innovation in this space is that for historical reasons the terminal / shell division makes it hard to innovate 

* Work on a fast moving project right from day one 


You will essentially function as a junior engineer on the team, and, as such, need to be able to write and ship production code.
Required Skills:
Candidates should have completed their first two years of CS education by their start date. 


The ideal intern candidate: 

* Is passionate about helping developers get more done - would jump at the chance to work on this particular product 

* Has amazing engineering chops but also product and user focused

Job Summary:
We're Waterloo EDC, the investment promotion agency for Waterloo Region. 
 
Waterloo EDC is not an organization that sits back and watches things happen. We make things happen. We are a dedicated and passionate team that works hard to ensure our community grows and thrives. 
 
  
 
We are the first point of contact for those looking to locate, relocate or expand in Waterloo Region. Waterloo EDC is in the heart of Waterloo's Innovation District, surrounded by tech leaders and entrepreneurs. In just three years, we have attracted more than $600 million in new investment to our community. 
 
  
 
Are you passionate about marketing and looking to make a real difference in the Waterloo community? We are looking for a talented, self-motivated and energetic candidate to work with our Marketing and Communications team in a collaborative and engaging environment. 
 
  
 
This is a truly unique opportunity that will provide you with great marketing and B2B experience for you to use in your professional life. In the context of our small team, students will take on projects and responsibilities as varied and significant to the organization as any full-time team member. 
 
  
 
JOB SUMMARY  
 
You will contribute ideas and work to meet team goals and objectives. You will support the activities of the Marketing and Communications team in promoting Waterloo Region. You will gain experience with marketing strategy, writing and communications, content development, social media management, market research, website and social media data analysis, event planning, graphic design and promotional layouts, and other administrative duties as necessary.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

Own a creative project of your choice, accounting for approximately 10% of your term
Collaborate with the Marketing and Communications team to deliver high quality, measurable partner and prospect engagement with our brand
Promote Waterloo Region to our target audience of international decision makers and site selectors
Manage Waterloo EDCs social media platforms including HubSpot, Hootsuite, LinkedIn, Twitter and YouTube
Assist with lead generation campaigns and HubSpot strategies and collateral
Write compelling content/copy for our blog, website, emails and other marketing collateral
Plan, implement and track marketing and communications campaigns
Work with key community stakeholders to promote the Region
Support the marketing and senior leadership team with the creation of executive briefing notes and presentations
Collaborate on marketing and communications strategies
Analyze target markets, competitors, website and social media analytics
Prepare marketing and organizational reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data
Track local news, media mentions and market trends
Update our website to ensure accurate information and compelling content is displayed
Support in designing and updating marketing materials
Support the Marketing and Communications team in various other functions as needed
Required Skills:
Skills required

Strong desire to innovate/develop new marketing initiatives
Business professional level of writing and marketing copy production (in English)
Impeccable editing skills with a demonstrated ability to proofread for spelling, grammatical or typographical errors
Strong research and analysis skills
Strong familiarity with MS Office
Social media management experience (Hootsuite, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube) an asset
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite an asset
HubSpot or marketing automation experience is an asset
Google Analytics, Adwords, and Tag Manager is an asset

Your competencies

Enthusiastic about marketing, communications and the Waterloo Region business community
Enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment and managing multiple tasks with short deadlines
Motivated and able to work both independently and collaboratively
Strong time management skills
Ability to manage competing priorities while meeting multiple deadlines
Critical and forward thinker
Strong written and oral communication skills
Results-focused
Strong attention to detail
Willingness to learn

Job Title: Associate Web Engineering - Reader Journey Squad
Job Summary:
Wattpad is a global multiplatform entertainment company whose vision is to entertain and connect the world through stories. Since 2006, we've been on a mission to use the power of community and technology to unleash the full potential of stories to the world. Every month 90 million people around the world spend over 23 billion minutes on Wattpad to share and discover stories they can't find anywhere else. Our brand banner includes Wattpad, Tap by Wattpad, Wattpad Labs, Wattpad Studios, Wattpad Books, and Wattpad Brand Partnerships. We're proudly based in Toronto, but our reach is global. Come build the future of entertainment and storytelling, and write your next chapter with us! 

  

You'll be working with the talented and passionate members of the Reader Journey squad. The team is a unique squad focussing on reader acquisition and engagement, and content discovery through recommendations and search. As a vital member of this squad, you will work with other web engineers, as well as collaborate with product designers, product managers, and platform engineers to create some awesome new web features. 

  

You'll be working on our Wattpad core web product. If you've always wanted to see your work used by (lots of!) real people, then Wattpad is for you: your contribution will be felt immediately by millions of users. The part you'll play is critical: from coming up with ideas to architecting solutions, you're able to touch every pixel on the page. 

  

Due to the current state with COVID-19, Wattpad will conduct all interviews in a distributed manner using applicable third-party software where needed and using visual interface tools such as Google Hangouts and Zoom. Our intention is to respect everybody's need for safety and adherence to social distancing.
Job Responsibilities:
- Writing Web applications in Javascript, creating and improving features for a web application, utilizing react for client-side rendering, and NodeJS for server-side rendering. 

- Building responsive experiences for mobile, tablet, and desktop 

- Collaborating with design and product management to define our next developments 

- Build new experiences for all our users 

- Measuring real-world user experience, and optimizing it 

- Working on an app with a massive scale (2 billion daily requests)
Required Skills:
- A self-starting, accountable attitude 

- Astute analytical and problem-solving skills 

- Excellent communication skills 

- Understanding of software engineering fundamentals and principles 

- Ample experience with Javascript, HTML, and CSS 

- Interest/knowledge in modern web development methodologies 

- A passion for users and making their experience the best it can be 

  

Bonus points if you have:

- Familiarity with ReactJS, Backbone, Node.js 

- Familiarity with Git 

- Knowledge of responsive design techniques and accessible markup 

- Interest in user experience, interaction design, UI development, and UI testing

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Wavy hosts online experiences for corporate teams, client entertainment, and communities. We work with experts to run high-quality experiences across food & drink, wellness, arts, entertainment and games, and have a platform that makes attending online events easy and exciting. Our mission is to help teams build a remote company culture that's better than an in-person one. 


Since launching in May 2020, we've hosted two festivals and worked with 80+ companies to bring people together through shared online experiences. Today, we're working on our platform to help companies build a great remote employee experience. We're quickly expanding by working with new partners and clients across North America (and beyond) and are excited to be building something new in the remote workspace. Won't you join us? 


As our Partnerships Coordinator, you'll be responsible for supporting all operations and marketplace tasks and projects.

We are looking for someone that will help us with our day-to-day operations. We work with a number of experience curators and kit delivery services to provide high-quality experiences to our clients. Event management and support like execution plans, setting up and publishing experience-related content, helping out with booking and event coordination etc. 
Manage FAQs for key stakeholders, including clients, employees, and hosts
Working with the team and hosts to design and/or curate new virtual experiences
Acting as the voice of our customer for internal strategy, from product strategy to testing, and new feature releases

We're looking for someone who is a self-starter, takes pride in their level of organization, geeks out on operational efficiency, and has excellent written and verbal communication. You are passionate about the future of work, human relations, team building, virtual (and non-virtual) experiences, and new technology.  


Here are some skills that would be beneficial to this role:
 

Proficiency with Google Suite, AirTable, Zoom, and HubSpot.
Self-motivated and able to work under minimal supervision.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Experience in event management and/or planning.
Basic design knowledge (e.g. Adobe Suite, Sketch, Canva).
