Job Summary:
Wavy hosts online experiences for corporate teams, client entertainment, and communities. We work with experts to run high-quality experiences across food, drink, wellness, arts, entertainment and games. Plus, we have a platform that makes attending online events easy and exciting. Our mission is to help teams build a remote company culture that's just as good (or better) than an in-person one. 


Since launching in May 2020, we've hosted two festivals and worked with 60+ companies to bring people together through shared online experiences. Today, we're working on our platform to help companies build a great remote employee experience. We're quickly expanding by working with new partners and clients across North America (and beyond) and are excited to be building something new in the remote workspace. You will be our first SDR working with innovative companies across Technology and Enterprise. Won't you join us? 


As our first Sales Development Representative, you'll be responsible for reaching out (yes cold reaching out) and connecting with potential clients over email, chat, and calls. You'll be working directly with Julia El-Safty, Head of Sales, and Shawn Hewat, Co-founder & CEO, to build our pipeline, grow existing client relationships, and bring in new clients.
Job Responsibilities:
Key responsibilities include (but are not limited to): 
 

Handling inbound calls and returning calls quickly. Our clients have lots of choices and timeliness is a core function of this role. We strive to reply to clients within 24 hours of the first contact. 
Speaking to clients and selling them experiences that meet their company culture needs. We have a suite of offerings and it's your role to find something to fit each client's specific goals. 
Continuously growing the client base by reaching out to new and existing leads. Once you become familiar with our offerings, you will be responsible for seeking and nurturing new leads and channels. 
Conducting post-sale data validation and administrative processes. Yes just because the sale is closed doesn't mean your job is done! Handoff to our Operations & Client Success team and upselling will be part of your role. 
Actively participating in product development and process improvement initiatives. You will be one of the closest team members to our clients. You will see the pain points in our processes up close we will rely on you to drive solution-focused iterations in the product and our systems. 
Working on additional projects to support Sales and Marketing initiatives. We are relying on you to pitch new ideas around how we sell and to whom we sell. We imagine you would start to pitch new ideas after 6 months with our team once you have a good sense of how we work and our clients.
Required Skills:
We're looking for someone who is a self-starter, is a people person (loves to chit chat), loves solving big puzzles, and has excellent written and verbal communication. You are passionate about the future of work, human resources, team building, online (and offline) experiences, and new technology. You are also excited to join a startup you know it is going to be hard at points. You understand that we very much don't have a plan for every outcome but you are excited to figure things out together. If you need stability in what your job will be each day, this job is likely not a fit for you. That's okay we just figured we should be totally honest upfront.  


Ideally, you have experience working in a client-facing role at a B2B SaaS company (bonus points if you've worked with startups and technology companies with 100+ employees). Here are some skills that would be beneficial to this role:
 

Passion for selling and providing exceptional customer service. Be prepared to come with examples. 
Energetic self-starter, with an ability to adapt to a transforming business. Self-starter is thrown around ALOT we mean that if you need a resource that doesn't exist, you don't wait around for someone else to create it, you do it yourself! Self-starter is essential in this role. 
Proficiency with Google Suite, HubSpot, Airtable, Excel, Zoom. We are an online events company after all.

Wawanesa Insurance is currently hiring an Actuarial Co-op students to assist on a variety of challenging and impactful projects in our Property & Casualty Actuarial Pricing teams. The work term will provide an opportunity to gain experience in a key actuarial function.   


You will contribute to and support the actuarial group using knowledge from relevant course work and the actuarial exams. Document completed work for ongoing use by Actuarial staff

Job Summary:
Wealthsimple is on a mission to help everyone achieve financial freedom, no matter who they are or how much they have. Using smart technology, Wealthsimple takes financial services that are often confusing, opaque and expensive and makes them simple, transparent, and low-cost. We're the company behind some of Canada's leading digital financial products, and are growing faster than ever. 


Our team is reimagining what it means to manage your money. Smart, high-performing team members will challenge you to learn and grow every day. We value great work and great ideas - not ego. We're looking for talented people who love a fast-paced environment, and want to ship often and make an impact with groundbreaking ideas. 


We're a remote-first team and output is more important than face time, so where you choose to work is up to you - as long as you have internet access, you can work from anywhere in Canada. Be a part of our Canadian success story and help shape the financial future of millions - join us! Read our Culture Manual and learn more about how we work. 


At Wealthsimple, we are building products for a diverse world and we need a diverse team to do that successfully. We strongly encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. Wealthsimple provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations or adjustments throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know. 


Engineering @ Wealthsimple

Wealthsimple has several engineering teams ranging from product focused to back office and our teams build and manage the software that powers our services. We do this using a microservice architecture and an agile approach, focused on short iterations and rigorous automated testing, deploying our code over 100 times a day. We maximize our productivity by building high-performing teams and giving them autonomy to deliver results, working very closely with product management, design and operations to make sure that our work delivers maximum benefit for our clients. 


Co-op Students @ Wealthsimple are completely integrated in the teams they join and get to work on meaningful projects during their time with us! This Winter 2022, we're looking to add Full Stack and Backend Engineers to our growing teams! Throughout the interview process, we'll learn more about your skills and interests to match you with the right team at Wealthsimple.
Job Responsibilities:
We're looking for people who:

Are driven to ship frequently
Take ownership and pride in working on projects to successful completion
Enjoy tackling new, complex challenges on a regular basis
Are comfortable with self-directed learning
Believe that debate, inclusivity and transparency result in better products
Are eager to learn from your team and others. We value making one another successful!
Required Skills:
Things you should know about our tech before applying:

We have a microservice architecture with over 100+ services in production
Roughly half of these services are Ruby on Rails, with the other half being Java/Kotlin
Our frontend application is a mix of React/Angular
We host our services on AWS and use things like RDS, Aurora, SQS, SNS, S3, Kafka, etc.
We follow best practices and have great tools for profiling, logging, tracing, tracking and experimenting

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Systems Security and Cryptography 
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Webveloper is a San Francisco based start-up striving to become the operating system for small businesses worldwide, providing everything they need to succeed in the information age. We provide businesses products ranging from a stunning yet easy to edit website, to an instant e-commerce business for their formerly brick-and-mortar establishment, to helping them establish partnerships with food delivery apps.

We're a young and dynamic team - our CEO is a serial entrepreneur who founded, scaled, and sold his first start-up after dropping out of his first year of college. Our team also consists of upper-year Waterloo students and alumni with experiences working at companies like Facebook, Google, Apple, Lyft, and Tesla, and in addition, several other full-time engineers from all over the world.

We're searching for two full-time remote UX Design Interns to join the design team at Webveloper.

Please submit your portfolio link in your application.
Job Responsibilities:
We're seeking a UX Designer to design compelling experiences that will improve the way small and medium business owners manage their businesses. The designers are going to be working on our core product dashboard in order to make it easier for businesses to manage their online presence. 

As an intern, you will have to overcome various design challenges as well as execute visually to communicate and solve problems. You'll use your full range of skills from product design, interaction design, and visual design to build magical experiences!

- Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product and engineering team
- Turn product concepts into compelling UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how the product function and look like
- You obsess over details and are excited to polish until your work is pixel-perfect.
- Conduct multiple rounds of usability testing to gather qualitative and quantitative feedback for your wireframes and mockups
- Iterate on designs based on user feedback
Required Skills:
- Relevant internship work, work experience, or personal project in UX Design or product management
- Ability to think strategically about product
- Ability to execute on visual and interaction details
- Demonstrated proficiency with design tools (e.g. Sketch, Figma, After Effects, Principle, Framer Studio, etc), 
- Experience working with engineers and communicating on design specs
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems

				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Webveloper is a San Francisco based start-up striving to become the operating system for small businesses worldwide, providing everything they need to succeed in the information age. We provide businesses products ranging from a stunning yet easy to edit website, to an instant e-commerce business for their formerly brick-and-mortar establishment, to helping them establish partnerships with food delivery apps. 


We're a young and dynamic team - our CEO is a serial entrepreneur who founded, scaled, and sold his first start-up after dropping out of his first year of college and our CTO is a recent Software Engineering grad! Our engineering team also consists of many other upper-year Waterloo students with experiences working at companies like Facebook, Google, Apple, Lyft, and Tesla, in addition several other seasoned full-time engineers from all over the world. 


We're searching for a full-time remote Software Engineering Intern to join the Engineering team at Webveloper.
Job Responsibilities:
As a company founded by students, we believe that interns shouldn't be treated differently from any of our other full-time engineers. You'll be working with our other engineers to help architect, implement, and ship several projects touching the entire stack, including the front end, back end, and operational side of Webveloper. Most engineers specialize in one of these fields and spend the majority of their time on that part of the system. Engineers will also be expected to participate in regularly scheduled meetings and eventually take on code review and on-call responsibilities. Based on your specific skills and interests, you'll be matched to one or more ongoing projects to contribute to with other full-time engineers, helping to ship it to completion. 


Upcoming projects that engineers might have the opportunity to work on include adding features to our website editor, creating an email client and automated scheduling tool on top of the GSuite API for use by customers, and migrating our local development infrastructure to the cloud!

Job Summary:
A Firm for Entrepreneurs

   

Welch LLP is ideal for professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit.  Welch offers its employees invaluable prospects: possibility for growth and advancement; variety to explore different career paths; opportunity to specialize and deepen skills; and flexibility of work-life balance to enjoy family and personal interests.   

   

Grounded in a values-led culture (care, impact, empower), Welch is focused on creating a diverse and inclusive environment, nurturing women in leadership, and supporting its surrounding communities.  At Welch, we know our employees are our number one asset.  It is our people that enables Welch LLP to be a firm like no other. 

National Firm expertise, with the value and service of a small firm  

   

Established in 1918, Welch evolved from a single office to 12 offices and over 300 people across Ontario and Western Quebec. Welch LLP has deeps roots in the communities it serves, and ranks as the 14th largest accounting firm in Canada and continues to grow.   

   

Headquartered in Ottawa, the key to Welch's success is continually evolving to meet the needs of its employees, clients and the marketplace.  With a full suite of professional services, ranging from traditional assurance to expert business advisory, our clients respect and value the firm's expertise and commitment to exceptional service. Welch's clientele is as varied as the economic landscape, ranging from start-ups to large, multi-divisional privately-held companies, not-for- profit organizations and public sector entities.
Job Responsibilities: Welch LLP Toronto is looking for a co-op student, who is currently working towards completing an Accounting Degree, for a four (4) month co-op placement from January April 2022. As a Co-op Staff Accountant, you will be challenged with taking on increasingly important audit and accounting roles on client files in a variety of industries and business sectors. You will work closely with all members of your team including managers and partners. You will have an opportunity to work in an environment that builds on the strengths of every employee and promotes their professional and personal development. This co-op position will allow you to gain exposure to both audit and tax. Work location will be hybrid, with a combination of in-office and remote work.
Required Skills:
Your primary tasks will include preparing notice to reader and review engagements, participating in audits, and preparing personal and corporate tax returns. You will be provided with the opportunity to learn how to manage your workload in a fast-paced environment and work on accounting files in their entirety. You will also be provided with ongoing support in order to be successful in your role. 


The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills and the ability to maintain good relationships with people; show a good deal of initiative and judgment; and be able to recognize and analyze problems and propose sound solutions.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Business
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Coop Student (2 positions)
 
 Location: Belleville, On  

Category is Coop
Date is January 2022-April 2022

  

Co-op student - Staff Accountant (2 positions) - Belleville (on site)

Welch LLP is a mid-sized full service firm of Chartered Professional Accountants-Chartered Accountants, with a staff of over 300 people in 12 offices in Eastern Ontario, Western Quebec and the GTA - making Welch LLP the 14th largest accounting firm in Canada. Headquartered in Ottawa, Welch has been helping clients since 1918. 

  

Welch LLP has offices in Belleville, Trenton, Napanee, Campbellford, Tweed, and Picton, which comprise   Welch's Quinte Region. 


Welch is currently seeking two Co-op Students -  Staff Accountant for the  Belleville  office from January  2022 - April 2022. 


This position will appeal to co-op students who are currently working towards Business or Economics degrees and are looking to gain practical experience with a dynamic organization in a friendly atmosphere. 


Come work, live, and play in a beautiful part of Eastern Ontario, The Quinte Region. 



Welch is a CPA training office.
Job Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work both independently and be part of a team in maintaining accounting and bookkeeping records, preparation of working paper files including audit and analysis, and in the preparation of personal and corporate income tax returns. The candidate will participate in the audit of the financial statements of diverse businesses and clients, and will be given exposure to the Income Tax Act, the financial statement presentation and disclosure issues, and owner/manager remuneration issues.  The candidate will work closely with all team members including senior managers and partners. 

This is for the period January  2022 - April 2022.
Required Skills:
This position will appeal to co-op students who are currently working towards Business or Economics degrees and are looking to gain practical experience with a dynamic organization in a friendly atmosphere. 


The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills (written and verbal); ability to maintain good relationships with people, demonstrate ability to be customer focused, show a good deal of initiative and judgment; and be able to recognize and analyze problems and propose sound solutions. 

The ideal candidate intends to pursue a CPA.  

A vehicle is recommended.

Job Summary:
Westcourt's primary focus is the selection of suitable investment products and the construction of well-diversified investment portfolios designed to provide attractive risk-adjusted returns in all market environments.

Westcourt performs extensive due diligence on investment products across all asset classes and investment strategies including private debt, private equity, real estate, stocks, bonds, hedge funds and special opportunities. We have advised on the deployment of over $4 billion in assets since the firm was founded in 2009.

The Department of Research & Analytics requires a diligent individual with great analytical and communication skills. Reporting to the Director, Research & Analytics, the Co-op is responsible for helping our team make informed decisions on the selection of suitable investment products for our high net-worth clients.

Job Summary:
Whitehorse Liquidity Partners ("Whitehorse"), based in Toronto, is a fast-growing private equity firm focused on accelerating liquidity on private equity portfolios through structured solutions. Whitehorse seeks to provide customized and flexible liquidity solutions for private equity investors through the use of structured solutions with existing investors or outright purchases of portfolios which are subsequently structured into different securities. Whitehorse currently has US$7.9B under management. Whitehorse is seeking diverse, energetic, and dynamic individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, high-performance, entrepreneurial environment.  

  

The Technology & Data team is seeking a Technology & Data Intern Analyst starting in January 2022 with our Toronto office.  The Technology & Data team is comprised of the following three functional pillars:

 

Data & Analytics: Enabling advanced analytics, through accurate data and automation to provide deep insights to the Firm.  
Cybersecurity & Risk: Working across the firm to properly balance security with convenience, we believe that securing the firm requires a total team effort.  Utilizing a risk based approach and controls to protect the firm, mitigate risk and provide confidence that our assets are protected.
Infrastructure & Systems: Providing the right sized tools, processes and platforms to support growth and collaboration while also creating space for personal development and mind share.

The intern will gain exposure to all three Technology & Data pillars during their internship period (with a focus on software development).  They will also be encouraged to actively participate in firm-wide team meetings, investment committee discussions and projects. 

We are looking for self-motivated individuals ideally completing their senior year in 2023 (or 2024) with a degree in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or Math and have a demonstrated track record of curricular and extracurricular excellence. 


Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 


At Whitehorse Liquidity Partners, we are committed to being a truly diverse firm and fostering an inclusive and supportive culture.  Employing a talented, diverse and inclusive workforce is more than just an obligation; it is a critical component of our growth aspirations and a competitive advantage of our Firm. 

In addition, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible recruitment experience where all candidates are valued, respected and supported. 

If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know, so that we will work with you to meet your needs.  

  

For additional information on Whitehorse Liquidity Partners, please visit our website at www.whitehorseliquidity.com

  

We thank you for applying, however, only those selected to continue will be contacted.

Collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing data sets to support business needs, including the build-out and maintenance of data models
Applying automation and innovation on data platforms and any new development projects/initiatives aligned to business or organizational strategies
Collaborating with various technology/business/project teams to understand business data and provide analysis and requirements to ensure the data design/development initiatives are in line with the planned design and standards
Develop novel data visualization and applications
Develop APIs / tooling / algorithms to be consumed by other Whitehorse teams
Assist the Technology & Data team with other ad hoc projects as required

Experience in automation and pipeline tooling considered an asset

Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in work output
Ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure

Job Summary:
Whitehorse Liquidity Partners ("Whitehorse"), based in Toronto, is a fast-growing private equity firm focused on accelerating liquidity on private equity portfolios through structured solutions. Whitehorse seeks to provide customized and flexible liquidity solutions for private equity investors through the use of structured solutions with existing investors or outright purchases of portfolios which are subsequently structured into different securities. Whitehorse currently has US$7.9B under management. Whitehorse is seeking diverse, energetic, and dynamic individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, high-performance, entrepreneurial environment.  

  

The Asset Management team is seeking an Intern Analyst starting in January 2022 at our Toronto office. Interns will have the opportunity to work alongside seasoned investment professionals in a high-performing entrepreneurial environment, helping to deploy and manage capital through a unique preferred equity platform. Interns will be expected to support deal teams in the evaluation, execution and monitoring of investments across multiple industries and will also be encouraged to actively participate in firm-wide team meetings, investment committee discussions and projects. 


We are looking for self-motivated individuals with a strong interest in investing and a desire to gain exposure to a wide variety of industries through innovative transaction structures. Ideal candidates will be completing their senior year in 2023 with a degree in Business Administration and have a demonstrated track record of curricular and extracurricular excellence.

For additional information on Whitehorse Liquidity Partners, please visit our website at www.whitehorseliquidity.com

Conduct industry research, competitor assessments, financial statement analysis and financial modeling to evaluate the merits and risks of potential investments
Perform due diligence on private equity portfolios including evaluation of company dynamics, valuation and exit opportunities
Review fund and company performance, strategy and outlook, as well as macroeconomic factors and other relevant topics as required
Prepare internal investment memoranda and presentations
Monitor existing investments, including quarterly performance review and preparation of quarterly reporting package for Whitehorse investors
Assist deal teams with other ad hoc projects as required

Job Summary:
Do you imagine yourself in an organization where you honestly feel that you are making a difference; doing work that is interesting and challenging? Then you should seriously consider a Co-op placement at Wilkinson & Company LLP.
 
Our holistic approach fosters initiative, confidence and professional growth. As an accountant at Wilkinson you are responsible for all aspects of the engagement and are encouraged to develop long term meaningful relationships with your clients. In a supportive and collaborative atmosphere you will gain experience in all facets of the industry from financial reporting and assurance, to tax planning and compliance; enabling you to remain versatile, engaged and grow professionally.
 
As Eastern Ontario's leading regional accounting firm, we serve a broad range of industries and not-for-profit organizations providing our staff with extensive experience as well as interesting and challenging work.
 
 
Who We Are:
 
Wilkinson & Company LLP continues to grow and prosper; we are leaders in our field and committed to service excellence. We work as a team, for the firm, our clients, and for each other. At Wilkinson& Company LLP you will be given every opportunity to reach your full potential.
 
 
Why Choose Wilkinson:
 
- Hands on experience in many areas of the accounting field
- Exposure to many different industries
- Participation in Firm events
- Opportunities for employment after your term
Job Responsibilities:
Experience Profile:
 
Co-op Students will have the opportunity to gain hands on professional experience in many aspects of the public accounting services while with Wilkinson. We offer a full range of accounting services including:
 
- Audits, reviews, accounting, assurance and business advisory services
- Corporate and personal tax planning and preparation
- Forensic & investigative accounting services, including insurance claims and litigation support
- Personal financial planning and wealth management services
- Business valuations and restructurings
- Farm taxation and succession planning
- Business and family succession planning
- Estate planning services
- Business owner and executive retirement planning
- Mergers and acquisitions
 
Buddy Program:
 
Works closely with the assigned mentor for the purpose of professional development and ongoing support.
Required Skills:
Qualifications:
 
- Integrity
- Enthusiasm to all tasks assigned, professional in personal appearance and conduct and presentation of work.
- Honesty and ability to show respect and consideration for others.
- Maintains independence where the nature of the service requires it.
- Protects the confidentiality of all information.
- Practices professional courtesy.
- Maintains and enhances the profession's reputation.
- Adheres to the professional rules of conduct.
 
 
Apply today for your opportunity to work Wilkinson!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing

Organization: William Ashley China Corp (A Fairfax Company)
Job Summary:
William Ashley

William Ashley (WA) was founded in 1947 and it is the largest and most prestigious omnichannel Tableware retailer in North America, if not the world, carrying premier brands such as Waterford, Wedgwood, Royal Doulton as well as other well respected international brands.  


For 22 years, WA operated a Flagship store in the Manulife Centre at 55 Bloor St W in Toronto before moving in 2019 to the luxuriously renovated Flagship store in The Colonnade, 131 Bloor St W. 

  

WA is also famous for its hugely successful in-person William Ashley Warehouse Sale, held in the Spring/Summer and Fall. The Fall of 2021 will mark the 46th continuous year of the Sale, Covid permitting. 


William Ashley China Corporation is a subsidiary of Fairfax Financial Holdings Ltd and participates in the Fairfax Co-op Program. The Fairfax Co-op Program is looking for innovative, talented, and self-motivated University of Waterloo students who are interested in domestic and international work experience. For more information, please visit co-op.fairfax.ca! 


Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited is a financial services holding company which, through its subsidiaries, is engaged in property and casualty insurance and reinsurance and investment management. Fairfax's corporate objective is to achieve a high rate of return on invested capital and build long-term shareholder value. To learn more about Fairfax visit: www.Fairfax.ca.
Job Responsibilities:
In 2015, the totally rebuilt williamashley.com was launched. In 2020, the website served as a pivot to quickly transform WA into a digital first commerce company, which has continued apace in 2021. The resulting explosive digital growth brought many challenges, ones that the legacy ERP had problems fully overcoming. So, starting in the Fall of 2021, WA will be migrating to a new ERP, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, with completion targeted for Spring 2022. 


In tandem with the ERP migration, WA will be re-platforming to latest version of its digital commerce platform, Magento 2. This will transform the website from a web catalogue to one that facilitates a more personalized shopping experience, online and in the store.  

  

The co-op student will tasked with assisting with the ERP and Magento migration. This will give the co-op student an excellent opportunity to use their skills and/or add to the skills at the ground level of the transformation of the business, web processes and implementation of management systems. 


The co-op student will be part of a team that will be responsible for data migration, data management and reporting initially with a SQL database Excel via VBA and subsequently with BC365; they will assist in providing critical information flows for management and other users.

Job Summary:
Co-op Accounting Analyst

  

Williams and Partners LLP is a dynamic and rapidly growing CA firm where we enable our team members to maximize their professional potential by providing challenging and exciting opportunities for growth and advancement.  

  

We are looking for exceptional co-op students to join our team!

  

As a university student, you are starting out on your career path with endless choices before you.  Our mid-sized accounting firm will provide you with the optimal environment in which you can learn from the best, take on diverse challenges and projects, yet still get the one-on-one attention that you need to grow. 

  

While large enough to offer a wide range of challenges and opportunities with our diverse staff and clientele, we are small enough to provide hands-on training and experiences in a friendly and stimulating work environment.   You will get to work on a variety of projects with all levels of our team- from analysts to partners. 

  

As a co-op student at Williams & Partners, you will be part of the team involved in servicing our clients representing a wide array of businesses.  On your work term, you will be involved assisting our team of accountants in a full range of accounting, tax and advisory services through our hands-on, personalized approach.   

  

This position is developmental in nature and will provide an incomparable learning and development opportunity. 

  

If you are up for the challenge then we want to hear from you!


Applicants must include a cover letter explaining why they are the right candidate for this job.  In your own words, tell us why you are a great fit for this role and what sets you apart.  We get many applications so tell us why we should pick you. 

  

About Williams & Partners

Located in Markham, we are a rapidly growing accounting firm representing a wide range of clients across a variety of industries.  We are a recognized high-quality firm providing accounting and tax services to owner/managed businesses. Our team members are rewarded on several levels for their hard work, determination and entrepreneurial spirit.  We provide our team members with the hands-on experiences and opportunities necessary to grow and excel. 

  

For more information about Williams & Partners, please visit our website: www.wpllp.ca.
Job Responsibilities:
This co-op position runs from January 2022 to April 2022,  By the end of this work term you will have assisted our managers and partners with:
 

Entering trial balances
Posting journal entries
Preparing certain sections of the file, such as audit procedures for the sales/receivable cycle
Preparing complete Notice to Reader files
Assisting in the performance of Review and Audit engagements
Setting up new client files
Preparing simple tax returns
Preparing T4 & T5 slips and summaries
Required Skills:
We are looking for students who:
 

Are interested in pursuing a career in public accounting
Demonstrate academic excellence and leadership ability
Are solid team players with a strong desire to learn while being challenged, mentored and supported as you develop along your career path
Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Are motivated and enthusiastic self-starters willing to take ownership for their contributions to servicing our clients
Have strong computer skills (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Word, and Office) and previous experience using Caseware, Caseview and Taxprep would be an asset.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management

Job Summary:
The Company 

  

Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas - the dynamic formula that drives business performance. 


Create a career that goes in the direction you choose. Get to know opportunity. 

  

The Business 

  

Create your future.  Join our Retirement consulting team in providing expertise in retirement and investment consulting to support global organizations in optimizing the effectiveness of their employee retirement. Whether a client has a defined benefit pension or a defined contribution plan, we work with them to determine the right approach to designing, funding, investing, communicating, governing and employee management that fits their specific goals.  You will also learn about all the services that Willis Towers Watson offers their clients and how they complement and enhance our retirement consulting practice. 

  

Explore an opportunity.  Gain direct exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyze data, solve problems, develop solutions, and share your brilliant results.  In this role, you'll experience a balance of expanding your technical and industry knowledge and developing your problem solving and communications skills, while benefiting from working in a close-knit and supportive team environment.  

  

Accepted applicants will be eligible for a comprehensive actuarial exam study program, including paid study hours and exam coaching to assist in attaining an accredited actuarial designation.
Job Responsibilities:
Love your work.  You will partner with consultants to provide technical actuarial and consulting support on projects like:
 

Designing, funding, pricing, and the implementation and management of retirement programs
Competitive benchmarking analysis of benefit plan designs
Corporate restructuring and capital enhancement initiatives (demutualization, securitization, mergers & acquisitions)
Forecasting and carrying out investment studies
Performing asset/liability modelling
Performing annual pension (qualified and nonqualified) and post-retirement medical valuations for a variety of clients
Assisting with completion of plan reporting and filing requirements
Performing plan administrative tasks such as completing benefit calculations, reviewing plan documents and SPDs, and producing benefit statements
Preparing and assistance with the delivery of client presentations and communications
Required Skills:
Progress towards a Bachelors or Master's degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, finance or any other major with significant quantitative course work with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 (Junior standing preferred; Sophomore considered with other relevant internship experience)
Successful completion of one or more actuarial exams highly preferred
Work experience that demonstrates strong technical and/or client service skills
Passion for solving problems and sharing solutions to exceed the standards of the client
Ability to be a self-starter and work independently, but also cooperatively in a close team environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
The Company 

  

Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 45,000 employees serving more than 140 countries and markets. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas - the dynamic formula that drives business performance. 

  

Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com. 

  

The Business 

  

Create your future.  Our Health and Benefits business helps large and mid-size employers control soaring health and welfare plan costs, improve health outcomes and promote employee engagement through broad-based, state-of-the-art interventions.  We provide solutions encompassing creative plan design, vendor evaluation and management, pricing and funding strategies, data analytics, valuation support, and legal compliance and governance strategies.  We also provide specialty consulting services including clinical/health management program design, pharmacy solutions, disability/absence management strategies and claims audit services.  Product based solutions such as our pharmacy purchasing coalition round out our broad-based suite of offerings. 

  

Explore an opportunity.  As a Health and Benefits Intern, you will work beside some of the industry's top strategic consultants while you progress toward becoming a thought leader of the future. 

  

You will have immediate exposure to real client assignments which will draw on your imagination and creativity as well as your ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and present results. These experiences will help build your technical knowledge and overall industry expertise.
Job Responsibilities:
Love your work.  You will partner with consultants to provide support on plan management projects through:
 

Performing renewal analysis and negotiation, financial analyses, including developing pricing for alternative design features, creating employee contribution strategies, modelling plan design alternatives, and calculating reserves
Analyzing and comparing vendor products, services, and contracts
Designing, distributing, and evaluating qualitative and quantitative responses to surveys and RFPs
Plan Management activities requiring coordination with our clients
Required Skills:
Progress towards a Bachelors or Master's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, finance, public health, health management, actuarial science or any other major with significant quantitative course work with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0
Work experience that demonstrates strong technical and client service skills (analyst or client service type of internship preferred)
Passion for and ability to solve problems and share solutions to exceed the expectations of the client
Exceptional project management and organizational skills to effectively manage a variety of projects within a specified timeline
Ability to be a self-starter and work independently, but also cooperatively in a close team environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent Microsoft Office skills, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint

Job Summary:
Wind River believes that some things are so important they simply cannot fail. That is why we exist. Wind River software has been running the computing systems of the most important critical infrastructure that demand the highest standards for safety, security, performance, and reliability. Found in more than 2 billion devices, Wind River is pioneering edge compute technologies to accelerate the evolution from automated devices to autonomous systems and we have a spot for you! 

To learn more, visit Wind River at www.windriver.com. 

  

The Role: 

Wind River Systems is looking to fill a position of Information Development Engineer - Intern to perform development activities for our RTOS products. The position is primarily porting code from open source to work on the VxWorks RTOS. He or she must be a highly adaptable team player who can quickly ramp up on our technologies and accomplish goals in a fast-paced agile environment. This position requires proven skills in software development and excellent oral and written communication skills.
Job Responsibilities:
What you will have an opportunity to do:  

·                Port open-source C/C++ software to the VxWorks RTOS    

·                Collaborate with other members of the development team, QA team and product managers.  

  

Depending on your skill set, you may also:  

·                Write documentation  

·                Develop software tools for documentation processing  

·                Create "how to" training videos  

·                Collaborate with engineers and writers to improve customer documentation  

·                Test labs for the Education development department
Required Skills:
Education & Experience:  

You will need:  

·                Excellent written and oral communication skills.  

·                Fast learner with the desire and ability to master new technologies  

·                Ability to analyze and decompose problems into potential technical solutions.  

·                Proficient coding skills with multiple programming languages, i.e. C, C++, Python, Assembly  

·                Experience with Git, GitHub  

·                Familiar or working knowledge of Linux environment  

  

If would be great if you also have:  

  

·                Availability for more than one consecutive term  

·                Experience with VxWorks is highly preferable   

·                Knowledge of Embedded operating systems   

·                Prior co-op experience in software development or technical writing for IT or scientific audience
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Writing, developing, testing and maintaining software tools and infrastructure.

Collaborating with other members of the software tools development team

Job Summary:
Wind River believes that some things are so important they simply cannot fail. That is why we exist. Wind River software has been running the computing systems of the most important critical infrastructure that demand the highest standards for safety, security, performance, and reliability. Found in more than 2 billion devices, Wind River is pioneering edge compute technologies to accelerate the evolution from automated devices to autonomous systems and we have a place for you! 

To learn more, visit Wind River at www.windriver.com. 

  

The Role:

Come join us at our Kanata R&D facility and help define our customers' Developer User Experience for a new strategic initiative at Wind River Systems. You'll play a pivotal role in defining, developing, and delivering a key component - leveraging your skills in user experience design.  You'll hone your Agile development mindset as you work towards your milestones, with an experienced team who are interested in your progress and ready to support your success.

Work hand-in-hand with the key stakeholders and developers using the web-based developer experience
Create something new, leveraging Wind River products to showcase bleeding-edge user experiences
Bring your strengths to bear in web design and development, within a supportive work environment
Create and showcase exciting proofs-of-concepts aimed at enhancing our customer experience
Have a chance to affect customer-facing content from a skilled student's perspective

A proven ability to learn, a strong work ethic, and self-motivation
Experience with Adobe XD, or similar tools.
A focus on delivering requirements, but interested in adding value to whatever you work on

Experience to conduct concept and usability testing and gather feedback
Experience with HTML/CSS and Javascript

Wind River Systems is seeking a high-performing test engineer for a coop position developing cloud-based software. Test leading edge, high performance cloud technologies.  
Work with the most dynamic and exciting open source software projects today - Openstack, Puppet, KVM  
Work as part of a team focused on virtualization, VM management and fault tolerant/carrier grade end to end system testing.  
Develop automated tests, enabling faster design and test cycles 
Develop full end to end system tests to validate the product as a customer would use it. 
Investigate and resolve issues reported during product verification and customer integration cycles  
Provide support to documentation and customer-facing teams  
Participate in all aspects of the software development process using agile development

Coursework toward a BSc / MSc degree (Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, or equivalent technical degree)

Join the team that's changing the Windsor-Detroit skyline! The Gordie Howe International Bridge project is a once-in-a-generation undertaking. Not only will the project deliver much-needed transportation improvements for international travellers, it will also provide jobs and opportunities for growth to the Windsor-Detroit region and includes features that make this project truly distinctive.  


Job purpose: As a Business Data Analyst Co-op student, you will work with users across the organization to understand how they use data in their department. You will then assist with translating that information into solutions that will bring the data from various systems into a data warehouse. We are looking to turn our data into actionable insights and meaningful recommendations that will help the organization obtain enhanced engagement across all business units.
Job Responsibilities:
Key accountabilities: 

Work closely with business users to understand and maintain focus on their analytical needs
Clean and transform data in Power Query (ETL)
Assist with the development of dimensional data models
Conduct data validation
Assist with developing self-service data models and reports using Power BI
Responsible for demonstrating Power BI reports to relevant stakeholders and adapting to feedback as necessary
Collect and examine data from various data sources and compiling it into a series of reports for distribution to project stakeholders
Help automate reporting pipelines and assist with building a real-time streaming dashboard
Performs other duties as required
Required Skills:
Work Experience / Requirements:

Ability to obtain and maintain a Government of Canada Personnel Screening/Security Clearance. Applicants must have 5 years of Canadian residence history. 
Ability to write complex SQL queries and perform analysis
Previous experience with Power BI, DAX and SQL will be preferred
Prior experience in data integration of disparate data sources preferred
Knowledge of design, development, and implementation utilizing current analytics technologies and architecture, as well as data warehouse concepts and methodologies preferred
Relational database concepts and design experience preferred


Core Competencies: 

Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Proven ability to take initiative
Confidentiality

Job Summary:
Wonolo (Work Now Locally) is growing and disrupting a $140bn legacy industry! Founded in San Francisco in 2014, Wonolo is a remote-first company with 170+ full-time employees fully distributed across the United States and Canada. We are experiencing explosive revenue and headcount growth, and backed by leading investors Sequoia and Bain Capital. 


We are committed to helping people find consistent work. Through our tech-enabled marketplace, we connect 500+ businesses (Peloton, Coca-Cola, Uniqlo, Nordstrom, Six Flags, etc.) in need of front-line workers with over 1 million underserved workers across the United States, within minutes. Every day, we create opportunities for people to find work, learn new skills, earn a living wage, and access portable benefits like insurance and flex time off. At the same time, we are saving companies money by efficiently connecting them with hard-to-reach talent and automating the recruitment process end to end. 


We are looking for an iOS Developer to join the team responsible for the end user experience of the worker (aka Wonoloer) community. You are passionate about mobile development and excited about working both on UI and infrastructure initiatives. In this role you will have visibility into all aspects of product development, and collaborate closely with our Design, Product, Data, and Engineering teams. 


Wonolo is one of Glassdoor's Best Places to Work 2021. Come join us!
Job Responsibilities:
Build new features from scratch using Swift
Write clean and maintainable code while iterating and shipping rapidly
Collaborate across functions to transform user pain points and business needs into intuitive experiences
Required Skills:
Experience building iOS applications in Swift, Objective C a plus
Ability to build high-quality iOS user experiences
Experience with client-server applications
Passion for mobile development

Additionally, you are:

 

Excited by the opportunity to build and support highly scalable, world-class products
Comfortable working in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments
Eager and willing to work in an Agile development environment
Humble, driven, creative, willing to make mistakes and learn from them, and excited to raise others up
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Wood Environment & Infrastructure Solutions has an opening for an Engineering Co-op Intern in the Oakville, ON office.  The Oakville office is home to a number of senior professionals crossing several disciplines providing the mining industry with geotechnical services and solutions.  This position is well suited to a candidate wanting to work on challenging projects and seeking opportunities for training and mentoring by senior professionals. 


Wood is a global leader in the delivery of project, engineering and technical services to energy and industrial markets. We operate in more than 60 countries, employing around 55,000 people, with revenues of around $10 billion. We provide performance-driven solutions throughout the asset life cycle, from concept to decommissioning across a broad range of industrial markets, including the upstream, midstream and downstream oil & gas, power & process, environment and infrastructure, clean energy, mining, nuclear, and general industrial sectors. We strive to be the best technical services company to work with, work for and invest in. 

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce.
Job Responsibilities:
The successful applicant will work closely with a number of more senior professionals within multi-disciplinary teams on mining projects involve tailings, mine design (open pit and underground operations), mine waste rock and water management.  

  

Work tasks may involve the following:
 

Assist on a variety of Project Services,
Assist with technical analysis, proposals and reports,
Assist with planning, data processing, analysis and reporting of upcoming geotechnical and rock engineering investigations as well as compilation of existing surface and underground geotechnical or geomechanical investigation data and design analyses (such as dam seepage, and slope stability and stress modeling), under guidance of more senior staff,
Assist and provide support to other engineering and technical staff. 
Work as an integral team member in a multi-disciplinary environment,
Review of topographic maps to identify watersheds,
Planning of possible tailings disposal sites and/or freshwater diversions,
Estimate of earthworks construction quantity (dams, channels etc.), and
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills:
The ideal candidate will have a good understanding of soil and rock properties, preferably with some experience conducting subsurface investigations and/or construction. 
Interest and/or experience in hydrology, geochemistry, geology, hydrogeology and hydraulic design is essential.

Job Summary:
Wood is currently recruiting for an Intern/Co-Op Process Wastewater Engineering position within our Environmental Process Engineering Group, based in our Cambridge, Ontario office.   

  

Our business is evolving at an incredible pace, creating fantastic new opportunities for those taking the first big step in their professional journey. We strive to embrace change and never stand still, and as a result, we are on the search for our next generation of brilliant young employees. 


At Wood, your early career will be a time of learning, discovery and development. You will follow a path of your own design, find work that excites you and pursue it. You will be given the freedom to manage your own workload, and assist in projects that you find interesting, or that fit your skillset. You will be challenged to manage budgets, competing tasks, and your chargeability. There will be many opportunities to take on more responsibility, to gain more experience, and push yourself and your skillset. 

The Environmental Process Engineering Group (EPEG) is Wood's multi-disciplinary wastewater treatment process design team, that integrates engineering design, environmental assessment and planning implications to enable successful implementation of wastewater treatment projects. The group is composed of 25 full-time, contract, and casual employees, at different locations across Ontario. Our group has designed industrial water and wastewater treatment processes, ranging in size from 25,000 to 25,000,000 gallons per day. Our process experience includes the complete range of technologies from simple conventional processes to emergent state of the art technologies. The team is engaged at all stages of work, from initial concept studies, data collection, and bench-scale work, through to preliminary and detailed process design. Most projects are executed with small- to medium-sized design teams, working closely together towards a common goal. Currently the majority of staff are working from home due to COVID however the situation is continually evolving. Specific work arrangements for the winter 2021 term are TBD. 


Wood is committed to achieving a diverse workforce and inclusive working environment. We recognize that each of us has many different diverse traits which shape our view of the world, our perspective and our approach.  


We create opportunities for you to connect, learn and grow. We offer competitive salaries, and opportunities to network with great minds, through the support of your colleagues and through peer-to-peer relationships. 

  

Diversity Statement

Wood is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in employment, recognizes the value of a diverse workforce, and complies with all laws regarding human rights.

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				ENG - Chemical Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering

Job Summary:
About Us

Woodbridge is a privately-owned company offering innovative material technologies for applications in automotive, commercial, recreational, packaging, healthcare and building products. In addition to manufacturing operations, the company also offers a full array of services including: chemical research and development, product and process engineering, tooling, technical support and accredited laboratory testing. Woodbridge operates more than 50 facilities across 10 countries, employing over 7,500 teammates and serving more than 600 customers worldwide. 


Please visit our website to find out more: www.woodbridgegroup.com   


The R&D support of the growing corporation is conducted at our Corporate Research and Development facility in Woodbridge, Ontario. Woodbridge is seeking ambitious and enthusiastic students who are keenly interested in obtaining experience working with the chemistry and production of moulded polyurethane foam.
Job Responsibilities:
What is the opportunity?

As a Co-op with a passion for Data Science you will help scientists at Woodbridge utilize the historical & new data that is generated from their work to tackle daily challenges more effectively. 


What will you do? Discover. Research. Build. Test. You will apply your education and skills to understand value of the data generated in Woodbridge's research & development labs. You will then use this data to increase the accuracy of experiments and analysis. The primary objective is to reduce the development/R&D times. The focus will be to create predictive models for existing data that allow the scientists and engineers to have a starting point (formulations) that are further along than starting a formulation from scratch. 


You will need to gather data that is stored in various points on the servers, consolidate in a central location, tie in the physical properties of those formulations, and create a common form for viewing. This consolidated data will then need to be analyzed to see if there are ways of creating predictive models that allow for said objective above. This will require you to immerse yourself in a business challenge with focus on developing an innovative solution. You will be challenged to step outside your comfort zone, and bring your teamwork, communication and collaboration skills towards a solution. 


What's in it for you?

You will work with highly educated and experienced individuals who thrive on the challenge of bringing new and innovative technologies that separate us from competitors. You will contribute to real projects that can make a difference and have a lasting impact at one of the "Best Managed" global manufacturing companies in Canada. You will also have the chance to let Woodbridge know who you are and what you can do for future opportunities while growing specific skills for your future.
Required Skills:
3rd/4th year student working towards a Bachelor of Computer Science in Data Science, Bachelor of Mathematics in Data Science or similar.
Familiarity with Microsoft tools including Power BI, forms, SharePoint with ability to pull data from existing databases and consolidate in dashboards and forms.
Gather formulation data from various sources, pair with testing data and present a universal formulation sheet/database.
Familiarity with data cleaning and data mining.
Ability to concentrate on loosely defined problems which require application of creative approaches.
Knowledge and ability to program in various languages for tasks to consolidate and mine data from various sources.
Familiarity with statistical methods.
Good interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written).
Creative and analytical thinker.
Ability to work in teams or individually.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering

				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

About Us

Woodbridge is a privately-owned company offering innovative material technologies for applications in automotive, commercial, recreational, packaging, healthcare and building products. Woodbridge is seeking ambitious and enthusiastic students who are keenly interested in obtaining experience working with the chemistry and production of moulded polyurethane foam.
Job Responsibilities:
Work primarily in a laboratory environment to screen introductory concepts which may involve hand preparation of polyurethane foam.
Prepare formulations and foam samples, including subsequent sample preparation for analytical testing.
Develop an understanding of the full potential of the more promising concepts.
Routinely test chemicals and foam using any of the following instrumentation: NMR, FT-IR, GC/MS, HPLC, DSC, KFT, k-factor, DMA.
Complete analytical foam testing using typical instrumentation including Zwick, Instron, Colorimeter, and other typical foam test instruments and equipment.
Evaluate the developed concepts.
Aid in the assessment of the technology by a plant trial in one of our manufacturing facilities.
Routinely summarize work and present findings to supervisors and occasionally the Chemical Research and Development team.
Present end-of-term findings to Woodbridge's Senior Leadership team.
Required Skills:
1. Firm grounding in Organic and/or Polymer Chemistry.  

2. Ability to communicate well in both a written and oral manner  

3. Strong analytical skills  

4. Independent worker and self-motivator  

5. Studying Engineering/Bio Chemistry/Chemistry 


Co-operative education employment with Woodbridge is an excellent opportunity to gain experience in industrial research and development, as well as, to gain an in-depth understanding of the unique area of polyurethane chemistry and how it is utilized to manufacture polyurethane foam.

Organization: Workplace Safety and Insurance Board of Ontario
Job Summary:
Ontario's Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) plays a key role in the province's occupational health and safety system. The WSIB is committed to the prevention of workplace injuries and illnesses, and administers no-fault workplace insurance for employers and their workers. The WSIB provides disability benefits, monitors the quality of health care, and assists in early and safe return to work for workers who are injured on the job or contract an occupational disease. The WSIB has over 4,000 employees, collects approximately $3 billion in premium revenues per annum and has benefit liabilities of approximately $28 billion. 


The Actuarial Division of the WSIB costs proposed legislation and policy changes, sets annual premium rates levied on various industry groups, makes long-term projections of revenues and expenditures, determines the reserves to adequately meet future benefit obligations, and formulates experience rating reserves and factors.
Job Responsibilities:
Job Responsibilities

The actuarial student's assignment within the Actuarial Division may include some of the following support tasks:
 

Data collection, validation and analysis.
Modifying existing Excel spreadsheet applications for pricing, valuation and financial projection systems.
Working with the AXIS actuarial software - building new valuation cells or modifying existing cells.
Assisting in preparation of documentation of existing processes.
Assisting in preparing reports for financial reporting purposes.

Hence this assignment represents an opportunity to gain valuable actuarial experience in the health insurance area of practice.
Required Skills:
Required Skills

The WSIB is therefore seeking an actuarial student with a combination of the following experience / skills:
 

Currently enrolled in the actuarial sciences programs and consequently familiar with interest rate theory and life contingencies.
Communication skills, both verbal and written;
Proficiency with MS Word, Excel and database management tools;
Some exposure to group health and disability insurance (e.g. pricing, valuation and experience rating); and
Some exposure to the AXIS actuarial software, in particular the Disability, Asset and Datalink modules, would be a plus.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

About the Lab


The WSIB Innovation Lab is an outpost of the Workplace Safety Insurance Board (WSIB) of Ontario. The Lab focuses on researching and developing new solutions for the future state of workers compensation in Ontario. This comes in the form of prototyping proof of concepts, engaging with start-ups or vendors whose vision aligns with WSIB's, and researching emerging areas of technology. 

  

The Lab is located in Communitech in Kitchener. Communitech houses many other corporate innovation labs, start-ups, and the Velocity Garage. We work in an open environment within a start-up culture providing us with the space, tools, and community to work with. We work in a flexible environment with flexible hours and encourage our co-ops to enhance their own skill-sets. Our organization is enabled to work from home and follows the public health guidelines to ensure the safety of all staff. Check out our website to learn more: (https://www.wsib-lab.ca).
Job Responsibilities:
THE DAY TO DAY

Creating, organizing, and planning content for projects, slide decks, and events
Driving meaningful engagements with stakeholders (External and Internal): introducing the Lab to new start-ups and companies, maintaining and tracking lines of communication
Arranging, Conducting, and Debriefing user interviews and research
Maintaining consistent communication and messaging from the Lab: blog articles, LinkedIn updates, and Innovation Newsletters
Required Skills:
PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS AND SKILL SETS

2nd / 3rd/ 4th Year student in English, Speech Communication, Sociology, Minors in Computer Science, or Arts, Science, Math, Health Sciences, and Business Programs, or similar (we are flexible)
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, Adobe Acrobat, Mac OS, and Keynote
Experienced communicator and team player: present ideas, drive discussions, and document team decisions, and standards
Ambassador: comfortable with working in a start-up environment, representing the Lab to visitors
General office experience

Available for longer than 4 months (preference 8-12 months)
Experience or willing to learn Adobe Creative Cloud
Experience presenting to and engaging with different audiences
Experience with visual design and photography
Experience with video editing and motion graphic development
Experience planning and executing events

Job Summary:
We're looking for some junior software developers to join various teams across the company. This can range anywhere from front-end development to database optimization to DevOps/SRE work. 


The role is an entry-level role. You'll work directly with a mentor engineer who will help spec out problems, guide your solutions, and give you code review comments helping to build better software. 


A little bit about us: Wrk is about dramatically simplifying automation. We're building a world where any process can be replicated by combining human skill sets and bots into pre-configured units of work that we call 'Wrk Actions'. We don't believe automation should be scary, complicated, or confusing to deploy. If you're excited about a journey where we can reinvent work together, where a hybrid human + machine delivers more, better, and faster than either alone, then come work with us. 

We are a team of highly experienced entrepreneurs, engineers, sales and marketing executives who have gone through the process of building, growing, scaling, and selling a business. Now, we're doing it all over again. We're looking to add like-minded individuals to our team as we embark on a journey to build a game-changing company, and take it public. The company was founded in 2019, has received funding from prominent venture capital and angel investors, and has a strong product-market fit with paying clients. 


We are a fully distributed company, the engineering team is spread all over the continent from Vancouver to Tampa - you could work from the beach in California or from a ski lodge in Whistler, up to you. We have a great mix of people in the team including junior engineers right out of school to people with 20+ years in industry, coming from all sorts of companies including Google, Amazon, NVIDIA, and loads of other startups. We take extra steps to make remote work fun, including small team happy hours, demo days, and online games.
Job Responsibilities:
As a software developer on this product, your responsibilities are to: 

* Build features and fix bugs to help improve our product. 

* Provide feedback on the code and designs of your fellow teammates. 

* Write unit tests, learn style guidelines, and integrate with our continuous-delivery systems to ensure rock-solid code that can handle the weirdness of reality.
Required Skills:
For all teams: 

* Software design patterns, OOP concepts, data structures. 

* Knowledge of internet protocols, most importantly HTTP. 

* Ability to communicate online: video chat, screen-share, text-based chat, email. 

* Nice to have: familiarity with UNIX toolchains: git, Linux, command-line. 

* Nice to have: familiarity with distributed systems, microservices, docker 


For front-end projects: 

* Experience with Javascript, CSS, HTML 

* Nice to have: experience with component-based frameworks like React or LitElement 

* Nice to have: experience with TypeScript 


For back-end or DevOps projects: 

* Experience with Python 

* Nice to have: experience with Django, Go, Ruby 

* Nice to have: experience with Docker, kubernetes, GCP

Job Summary:
Wysdom.AI is a fast-growing Conversational AI company helping businesses offer their customers natural language AI solutions that deliver automated customer service and support over chat, through smart devices, search, or on the phone. 


We do all the work for enterprises as their business evolves, from set-up to optimization.  Our customer's only job is to tell us what matters to their customers and what matters to them.  We'll take it from there, while providing the ongoing insights on how Wysdom is shaping the experience of the enterprise's customers.  


The Wysdom platform is built on a state-of-the-art NLP infrastructure, complemented with the tools, data and people to ensure successful operation of the suite of Wysdom products. 


Wysdom has analyzed millions of customer inquiries over the years, providing an extremely smart solution that only gets smarter with each question asked.  A core set of front-end artificial intelligence tools, and backend cognitive data management tools, coupled with our team of AI optimization experts, make up the framework of our solution. Our clients include large communications companies, banks, and insurance companies in Canada and around the world.
Job Responsibilities:
So what is a Wysdom Cognitive Data Analyst?


Behind every amazing AI-based solution is a team of really smart, passionate people. This is your chance to join this team as a Cognitive Data Analyst. With a passion for helping our clients deliver an amazing customer experience, your core role will be to train the Wysdom AI solution. Sound too techie for you? Don't worry - what we need is your analytical mind and strong communication skills. This is not a computer science role! We already have the tools to make this happen. 

  

As a Cognitive Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to get familiar and work with the life cycle of conversational bots. You will work on building chat bots, testing those bots and evaluating their performance. AI is the future and you will be on the front lines. 

  

Our clients are some of the top brands in the world. You will get a chance to not only see, but be a part of, how these companies are transforming their customer care operations into world-class digital experiences. Because let's face it - when was the last time you looked forward to sitting on hold waiting for a customer service rep to explain why your bill was so high last month? You want to find your own answer, on your own time - and that's what Wysdom does for our clients. 


Cool. But what will I actually be doing?

  

The day-to-day role will involve reviewing customer questions that our solution didn't answer - and determining why and what to do about it. You will review the customer feedback on answers we delivered to help our clients continually improve the responses that we deploy to their customers. 


Identifying why the answers and articles may not have been satisfactory, making recommendations and creating or updating customer communications will be a great opportunity for you to learn more about customer communications and hone your writing skills. 

  

Typical day-to-day responsibilities may include:

Create, review and edit Wysdom's customer facing information to ensure customers can easily understand and take action on the content
Maintain the quality and style of communications from Wysdom across all end users
Work with our clients to align with brand and style guidelines
Create write training and support materials

Oh, and did we mention that we also power the Facebook Messenger and other chatbot customer care solutions that our clients use? Now this could be fun!
Required Skills:
I'm in - but what do you need from me?

Strong writing and communications skills
Effective time management skills
"All hands on deck" mentality
Passion for delivering amazing results
Attention to detail
A sharp analytical mindset
Above-average Excel / Sheets skills
Bilingual Canadian French is an asset
