Responsibilities:

- Create test plans to support and perform various types of testing such as functional testing, performance testing, regression testing and more 

- Write automated test cases for pre-existing functionality and new development work 

- Support the development team with manual testing on new development that isn't yet covered by automation tests 

- Analyze test results, investigate, report, and track product failures and improve the areas with higher defect trends 

- Participate in the full development process with the team, performing estimation, prioritization, planning and coordination of testing activities 

- Conduct initial root cause analysis of identified defects and raise necessary tickets if it is a defect

Required Skills:

- Experience with manual testing or debugging 

- High attention to detail and great communication 

- Be eager to learn about the tools and technologies we use and excited to build new skills 

- Demonstrated ability to take ownership of projects and delivery 


Nice To Have Skills:

- Experience with automated tests and testing frameworks 

- Experience with any of: Javascript, Golang, Ruby, SQL, shell scripting 

- Hands-on experience with backend (REST API Services) automated testing tools (Postman) 

- Hands-on experience with front-end automated testing tools (Cypress, Selenium, Testcafe) 

- Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases

Zoocasa is an award-winning and passionate prop-tech scale-up obsessed with delivering exceptional consumer experiences in the real estate sector. We pride ourselves on being able to deliver because of our belief in, and support of, our talented and dedicated team. Our growth has been recognized by the Financial Times, The Globe and Mail, Canadian Business and Deloitte Canada. 


The Marketing Specialist will help Zoocasa meet their audience and growth targets through the use of the content, including website copy, news articles and blog posts. The Marketing Specialist will have exposure to utilize a range of digital marketing channels from; search engine optimization (SEO) to email marketing, social media, PR and more.  They will also gain an understanding of how these channels can work together to form an integrated digital marketing strategy.

We empower and collaborate with each other so all succeed

Our drive and curiosity allows us to adapt and innovate

Wordsmith: You can tell a story from beginning to end, and say what needs to be said in as few words possible
Storyteller: You have the vision to take any subject matter to output that is interesting, relevant and newsworthy
Analytical: You can break down complex information into simple output that is easy to understand, being able to use data to drive the story. You should be comfortable with Excel and working with large sets of numbers, data and interpreting data.
Quality control: You self-edit and submit only your best work

Job Summary:
We are currently seeking a Co-op Student to join our Molecular Simulations team. The successful candidate will participate in the building of computational protein modelling technology for use in biologics engineering and drug discovery. This position will be based in Vancouver, BC. 

This position will report to a Senior Scientist, Molecular Simulations. These positions will be based primarily on site in Vancouver, BC. Remote work arrangements may be accommodated depending on public health guidance. 

  

NOTE: Applicants who receive an offer of employment from Zymeworks Inc. must provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination (1 or 2 doses and the appropriate waiting period) to work onsite. Accommodations will be considered based on a verifiable medical condition or religious belief.
Job Responsibilities:
Assists with the application and development of machine learning methods, data analysis, and data-mining tools for protein engineering.
Assists with the research, development and optimization of software tools for protein modelling and engineering in collaboration with our Software Development team. 
Maintains clear, accurate records of all computational analyses, evaluates data and summarizes results for written reports and oral presentations.
Required Skills:
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, Physics, Chemistry, Biomedical Engineering or a related discipline.
Must be available for a co-op term of at least 8-months.  Successful completion of at least one relevant co-op term is preferred.
Must be able to work onsite in Vancouver, BC, without relocation assistance.
Proven interpersonal skills with an ability to work collaboratively as a member of a cross-functional team. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Highly motivated with a strong interest in machine learning methods and data science applied towards protein structure/property prediction and drug discovery. 
Proficient in a scripting language (eg Python, Perl, Ruby), and comfortable in at least one of C, C++, Java, or Fortran.
Knowledge and experience in developing and applying novel deep learning methods is preferred.
Knowledge of protein structure and biochemistry is preferred.
Fluent in spoken and written English with good communication skills.

Job Summary:
ABOUT US
 
Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S., Canada, U.K and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To-date, more than one billion people have played our games across Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.
 
OUR TEAMS
 
Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games, they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between front end, back end, and architecture roles.
Job Responsibilities:
You will be considered for software engineering opportunities in Zynga's DI team in the Toronto office.
 
Data Ingestion:
The Data Ingestion (DI) team is responsible for building our mobile Analytics SDK and a near real-time data ingestion pipeline. The mobile SDK is deployed in almost all Zynga games and allows us to collect a suite of data that forms the basis for many Zynga applications & reporting. Our ingestion system collects data from the SDK and scales to support nearly 17 billion requests per day. Working on the DI team would be a great opportunity to learn about mobile and server-side development. Our mobile SDK is built in C# and C++, and our ingestion system is built on Java and Go. You would also get hands-on experience working with popular AWS technologies such as SQS, Kinesis, Kinesis Analytics, lambda, ECS and EKS.
Required Skills:
WHO YOU ARE
 
+ You are smart, self-motivated, and eager to learn!
+ You love solving difficult problems, and not afraid of taking on things that you know nothing about!
+ You love coding, and passionate about making things more robust!
+ You love playing video games, board games, table tennis, or pool :)

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
 
+ Working towards a Bachelor/Masters in Math, Engineering or a related technical discipline (or equivalent)
+ Solid foundation in Computer Science - data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design
+ Experience in Java, Python, C/C++, JavaScript, or Go
+ Knowledge of Unity, C# or native coding isn't required but is an asset
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

OUR TEAMS
 

Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games, they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between front end, back end, and architecture roles.
Job Responsibilities:
You will be considered for software engineering opportunities in Zynga's Central Technology teams in the Toronto office. Here are some of the areas we're currently considering candidates for: 

  

Payments: The Payments team builds integral client and server components that drive revenue. You'll be developing new server features/adding enhancements using Java, JavaScript, and AWS technologies; or working on client features in Unity, C# and possibly native code for iOS and Android. You'll also be improving the performance/efficiency/stability of services that serve millions of API requests daily and working on new features to drive revenue growth through long term revenue streams.

OUR TEAMS

Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Job Responsibilities:
You will be considered for software engineering opportunities in Zynga's DI team in the Toronto office. 

  

Data Ingestion:

The Data Ingestion (DI) team is responsible for building our mobile Analytics SDK and a near real-time data ingestion pipeline. The mobile SDK is deployed in almost all Zynga games and allows us to collect a suite of data that forms the basis for many Zynga applications & reporting. Our ingestion system collects data from the SDK and scales to support nearly 17 billion requests per day. Working on the DI team would be a great opportunity to learn about mobile and server-side development. Our mobile SDK is built in C# and C++, and our ingestion system is built on Java and Go. You would also get hands-on experience working with popular AWS technologies such as SQS, Kinesis, Kinesis Analytics, lambda, ECS and EKS.

Job Summary:
ABOUT US
 
Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S., Canada, U.K and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To-date, more than one billion people have played our games across Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.
 
OUR TEAMS
 
Zynga's software engineers don't just develop some of the world's largest games, they deliver highly scalable infrastructure used by tens of millions of users every day. Our software engineers are blazing trails in all facets of game design, mobile technologies, and massive scalability. Zynga faces a number of challenges - but many are unique to our situation: the large data requirements of online gaming require us to continually push boundaries to discover the best solutions. Zynga software engineers are willing to pick up any of the languages, technologies, or methodologies necessary to smite a challenge - and if a conventional solution doesn't exist, they innovate as necessary. Our software engineers are comfortable moving between front end, back end, and architecture roles.
Job Responsibilities:
You will be considered for software engineering opportunities in Zynga's Analytics teams in the Toronto office. Here are some of the areas we're currently considering candidates for:
 
Application Platform Engineering: 
Our team builds systems and solutions for experimentation/optimization, business intelligence, user acquisition and various other analytics applications. The experimentation and optimization systems are used by game teams to conduct A/B testing, ramping up features, and optimize various aspects of social gaming. The business intelligence systems enable game teams to discover and gather players insights to make data-driven decisions. We also work closely with the UA managers to create solutions to streamline, automate, and optimize the user acquisition workflow. In addition to the core products mentioned above, we also collaborate with our analysts and data scientists to build new applications and platforms in Analytics. Our systems are built using a variety of tech stacks, including AngularJS, React, Node.js, Java (Spring), Python, Kubernetes, Docker, and various AWS technologies.
 
 
ML Engineering: 
Zynga's ML Engineering team applies cutting edge AI/ML to improve Zynga's games. We combine backend development, data engineering and data science. We develop production ML workflows with Spark, Python and Tensorflow. We also own high scale backend ML services written in Go. Our focus for AI is using Deep Reinforcement Learning to personalize our games, eg. using a player's history to decide what level to show next or how difficult to make a challenge. As industry leaders in the field, we've developed an open source library called RL Bakery and spoke at this year's Spark Summit. Our coops work on a variety of projects such as integrating new algorithms into our libraries, developing data pipelines, tuning AI models and adding features to our ML infrastructure.

Data Ingestion:
The Data Ingestion (DI) team is responsible for building our mobile Analytics SDK and a near real-time data ingestion pipeline. The mobile SDK is deployed in almost all Zynga games and allows us to collect a suite of data that forms the basis for many Zynga applications & reporting. Our ingestion system collects data from the SDK and scales to support nearly 17 billion requests per day. Working on the DI team would be a great opportunity to learn about mobile and server-side development. Our mobile SDK is built in C# and C++, and our ingestion system is built on Java and Go. You would also get hands-on experience working with popular AWS technologies such as SQS, Kinesis, Kinesis Analytics, lambda, ECS and EKS.

This platform is used by many Zynga portfolio games such as Words with Friends and Zynga Poker that are played by millions of users daily! You will build real-world systems that are highly scalable and robust using a variety of mobile and server technologies. 
 
Join us as we solve challenges developing and operating products at scale, impacting millions of players daily and support our games to achieve the highest levels of success through expertly crafted software. + Design, implement and maintain the mobile SDKs (iOS, Android and Unity) and core server components of Ad Tech platform.

Job Summary:
About Zynga: 
Zynga is a leading developer of the world's most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S , Canada, U.K and India. To-date, more than one billion people have played our games across Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.
Job Responsibilities:
About our PM internship:
We're searching for Intern/Co-op Product Managers for our locations throughout North America who can bring Zynga's games to the forefront of the industry: creating unforgettable social experiences, connecting hundreds of millions of people throughout the world and delighting its users through games. Equipped with user data, the Product Manager will have the creative freedom to provide experience, direction, and measurable performance to the game design process, resulting in creating high quality casual games for millions. 

Zynga's Product Managers are responsible for the full product/game life cycle, from writing specifications, working across multi-disciplinary teams: design, art, and engineering to launch core features within our existing and new games! They must exhibit sound product judgment, ability to formulate product strategy, and present clear measurable objectives that will lead to achieving our business goals. In addition, they will also be expected to provide valuable input into business cases based on in-depth data analysis and demonstrate how that analysis impacts key product metrics. Above all, we want Product Managers who are highly passionate about creating the best experience for our users. This is a highly impactful role where you have an opportunity to change the way the world plays!

Zynga is known for its data-driven culture, its entrepreneurial mindset, and its fast-paced, challenging work environment where each individual can make a difference.  We value strong analytical skills, problem-solving and quantitative experience. We look for great communicators, leaders and team players.
Required Skills:
We're Looking For:
 

Strong analytical and problem solving skills a must be working towards a Bachelor/Masters in Math, Engineering or a related technical discipline (or equivalent)
Exposure to a product management role and/or writing product specifications is helpful
Passion for creating fun and compelling user experiences
Experience with metrics-driven decision making
Demonstrated capacity for developing and understanding strategy
Aptitude for determining the optimal way to position products in the market
A track record for high performance and team/project leadership
Enthusiastic, performance-driven self-starter and team player

Working closely with data scientists/analysts, you will be building high-performance & large-scale systems that bridge big data / machine learning technologies to analyze and optimize within our games. User Acquisition: The UA team works on building a user acquisition platform that drives the user growth for the Zynga game portfolio.  The platform is responsible for capturing billions of daily events from our mobile SDK and data partners, ingesting and transforming complex datasets to be used for performance reporting.  It is an excellent learning opportunity in data engineering (ingestion, manipulation, ETL, and performance tuning) using tooling in SQL, Python, Airflow, and Databricks.
 
Analytics: The Analytics team is responsible for managing Zynga's massive dataset and ensuring it's accurate, reliable, and available whenever needed. You'll be working on challenging big data, optimization and machine learning problems to help us get the most out of our data. You will build real-world highly scalable, robust applications using technologies like Python, Java, Go, React and AngularJS and leveraging the latest from AWS, Spark and other big data platforms.
 
Payments: The Payments team builds integral client and server components that drive revenue.
